item.title: Customer Golf Days
item.dc:creator: dgibson
item.content:encoded: S&B Commercials have membership of an excellent local golf course called Lamerwood Golf and Country Club in Wheathampstead. We organize a monthly competition between a group of customers, both sales and aftersales clients are welcome to attend. It is a very relaxed day, usually starts with a bacon roll around 10.30, followed by eighteen holes of golf and a light meal after. Prizes are given for the best score on the day, which are Mercedes branded items-well worth winning ! The handicaps range from single figures, right up to 20 plus, so everyone gates a chance of participating. It is an opportunity to meet with other customers in a similar industry, and meet sales and aftersales staff alike.  Full details can be obtained from David Gibson-Truck Sales Manager.

item.title: Servicing Mercedes Vans and Trucks - not a lot of people know that.......
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: It came to me in a flash of inspiration this morning that most of our customers probably don't know about how flexible the options are when it comes to us servicing  their Mercedes van or truck..... For starters, of course we offer traditional servicing in the sense that you can book a slot, drop your vehicle off and return later that day to pick it up. However in most cases you need your van or truck and without it, its almost impossible for you to work. We all enjoy a day off now and then, but surely that should be at your leisure and not your vehicles! So, at S&B we wanted to make owning a Mercedes van or Mercedes truck a truly rewarding experience and that starts with customer service and what we can offer you when it comes to you checking your vehicle in for a service: For those customers that want to drop their vehicle off and return later in the day, we can offer arrange to lend you a Mercedes van to get around in. At least that way you don't lose a days work and you can avoid paying a couple of taxi fares to get too and from the dealership. If you want to take advantage of a loan van it pays to book it well in advance, as we have a limited supply and after reading this, I'm sure that many of our customers will be taking advantage of it! At our branch in Welham Green, we offer a new Van Express Service. Customers that use this service have two dedicated bays in a separate part of the workshop where there are a limited number of slots each day. These are best utilised for servicing and minor replacement work (for example changing brake pads) and enable us to offer our customers a 'while you wait service'. On site we have a canteen, TV and vending machines to help you to relax in comfort and in the near future we hope to provide our customers with wireless broadband and maybe even a pc to help them work while their Mercedes van gets some TLC. As I said earlier, it's often inconvenient to get your Mercedes van or truck serviced during working hours. Perhaps I should have qualified that by saying 'during your working hours'. Our branch at Stansted is open until 12am on weekdays and our branches at Thurrock and Welham Green are open 24 hours from Monday at 7am right through until Saturday at 1pm. Great! now you can sleep while your van or truck is serviced! And finally...... you know that canteen that I mentioned at Welham Green? If you smile and ask our service team nicely, they have often been known to hand out the odd breakfast voucher when you check your vehicle in!

item.title: Mercedes Sprinter Van gets greener with ECOstart
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In today's financial climate, we're all trying to save a bit of money and if we can help the environment at the same time, that's got to be a good thing hasn't it? [caption id="attachment_48" align="alignright" width="150" caption="ECOstart Demo Van"][/caption] Available on the Mercedes Sprinter van, the ECOstart option does just that. A clever bit of kit switches off the engine when you're stuck in traffic, and lets face it, that happens quite a lot these days. Now the sceptics amongst you are probably now saying "that's not going to save a lot of money!" but you may be a bit surprised. In the literature for Ecostart, Mercedes-Benz claim that their vans fitted with ECOstart can pay back the cost of the option by saving fuel within 2 years, if the van averages around 25,000 miles pa. In addition to the financial and environmental benefits, the option also cuts noise pollution and reduces driver fatigue. I must admit, when I borrowed our test drive model for the weekend at first I found the ECOstart experience quite disconcerting, but after a few engine stops you soon get used to it and its quite pleasant when you pull up at the lights and the already quiet engine goes silent. It gets my vote for sure!  If you want to give it a try, get in contact with our sales team and they'll book you in for a test drive.

item.title: Repair and Maintenance and Service contracts - control your budget
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: In these troubled economic times, the last thing that a small business needs is a huge unexpected repair or maintenance bill for their Mercedes van. Thankfully the generous warranty supplied with Mercedes vans takes care of most of the nightmare scenarios, but not all of them. One thing that small businesses can do to help keep costs under control and improve cash flow is to take a leaf out of the book of big fleet operators of Mercedes-Benz vehicles. What these operators do is to sign up to a service or "Repair and Maintenance" agreement. Depending on the type of vehicle you have, your annual mileage and what you use your vehicle for, a contract can be tailor made for you. That way you can pay Mercedes-Benz a fixed monthly direct debit and not have to worry about one off servicing and repair costs for your van. Owners of Mercedes Vito and Sprinter vans have two extra options called service package and service package plus. These options allow Mercedes van owners to pay a one off up front cost at a special price to cover all routine servicing and maintenance for 5 years or 120k miles, with a further fee allowing for brakes and clutches as well. If you are interested in getting a service package for any Mercedes van or truck, we have a specialist on hand to take your call. You can contact Lorna by phone on 01279 712233 or drop her an email at lornagemmil@sbcommercials.co.uk

item.title: Mercedes Vito and Sprinter Vans cruise control
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: One of the great advantages of having cruise control fitted to your Mercedes Van is that you can concentrate on the road ahead of you without having to constantly keep an eye on the speedometer. There are cameras everywhere these days all waiting to punish a momentary lapse of concentration, making the honest driver have to constantly check how fast he's going. When I drive with cruise control on, I often find that I end up at my destination much more relaxed. I often pass motorists as they tend to slow down a bit when they start to climb a hill until they realise and creep slowly back up to the speed limit. It's not really until you have driven with this feature that you realise how much others speed alters while they're driving. The Mercedes Van Cruise Control system has an additional feature (other than of course being able to maintain your speed). It is also able to limit your speed. This is ideal when you enter an area controlled by average speed cameras and the compact stop-start nature of congested traffic makes it unsuitable to use cruise control. You can easily set a limit whilst driving and the system will not allow you to exceed it unless you use one of its override "triggers". If you didn't specify cruise control on your Mercedes van when you ordered it, then all is not lost. S&B Commercials have a very popular offer that we sent out in our latest Email Newsletter. We are now in a position where we can retro-fit the Mercedes-Benz genuine cruise control system to your van using the proper Mercedes-Benz wiring looms, control stalks etc at a special price. This limited offer is available at £199.99 for Mercedes Vito Vans and £249.99 for Mercedes Sprinter Vans (the extra cost is because the accelerator pedal needs to be replaced). These special prices include genuine parts and labour.

item.title: Mercedes Vito 109 Sport Van for £12,995*
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We have a new offer for those of you that are tempted by the Vito Sport vans, but are looking for a more frugal option compared to the Vitos that boast a v6 engine. The Vito 109 compact Sport van definitely has the looks with 16"  alloys, chrome finishing and 'Sport' badges and is available in Arctic White, Magma Red, or Atlantis Blue. Where it differs is with its engine. The van has a frugal 95bhp/70KW engine that develops an impressive 250Nm of torque - more than enough to justify its sporty looks. Of course being a Mercedes-Benz van it comes with a lot of important safety features included in the price including ESP, ABS, ASR, BAS and EBV - if you're not sure what all that means, request a brochure and all will be explained! Then compare it to its competitors and you'll see that it leads the way. With class leading residuals and the best overall running costs, Mercedes-Benz vans are always the right business decision. However this one really steals the show - for only £12,995 + Delivery (£700) + Optional twin rear doors (£160) + RFL + VAT you get a lot of van for your money, with the extras and looks to make you and your business stand out from the crowd. Put that together with the superior engineering and innovative features that you expect from Mercedes vans and you're on to a real winner.

item.title: Family values pay dividends for S & B Commercials
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Winners... S & B Commercials’ Ron Holmes, second left, and Daniel Holmes, right, accept the coveted Dealer of the Year trophy from Wilfried Steffen, second right, and Ian Jones, left, of Mercedes-Benz      Family values pay dividends for S & B Commercials   Strong growth coupled with a ‘family business’ ethos and commitment to customer service has won S & B Commercials Plc the Mercedes-Benz Commercial Vehicle Dealer of the Year award for 2010.   Chairman and founder Ron Holmes stepped up to collect the coveted trophy from Wilfried Steffen and Ian Jones, respectively Chief Executive Officer and Commercial Vehicles Managing Director of Mercedes-Benz UK.   S & B Commercials represents the famous three-pointed star in Hertfordshire, Essex and North and East London, from impressive headquarters in Hatfield and other dealerships in Stansted and West Thurrock.   It beat off the challenge of 20 other franchisees nationwide to claim the manufacturer’s most prestigious dealer award for the third time since taking on its Mercedes-Benz franchise in 1992.   The Dealer of the Year announcement at a ceremony in Berlin capped a great night for S & B. Earlier, Robin Bray was named Business Manager of the Year and Graham Balsom won the award for Van Sales Managers, while S & B took the prize for Mercedes-Benz CharterWay Best Performing Dealer of the Year – CharterWay is a commercial vehicle brand of Mercedes-Benz Financial Services.  S & B Truck Sales Manager David Gibson and Used Commercial Vehicle Sales Manager Trevor Siederer also made the final three in their categories.   There was more success for S & B in the awards presented annually by the Mercedes-Benz Truck Masters and Van Academy sales motivation and reward programmes. Steve North took the Van Academy’s prize for Most Notable Achievement by a Fleet Sales Executive, while colleagues Rob Brandon and Steve Wall were among only 12 executives from the entire country to win entry to the Truck Masters Diamond Club.   S & B Commercials is one of Britain’s biggest Mercedes-Benz dealers, with a turnover of some £80 million and a total staff of 295.  Nevertheless, as Ron Holmes explains, 30 years after it was founded the company remains true to its roots.   “Despite the very significant expansion we have been through over the last decade, we continue to operate as a family business with traditional values,” he said.   “We benefit from an exceptionally low rate of employee turnover and a stable team which includes no fewer than eight staff members who have been with us for 30 years or more, and numerous instances of fathers and mothers working alongside their sons and daughters.   “It is the loyalty and commitment of these people, combined with the fact that we operate on a very stable financial footing, that enables us to deliver the very best levels of customer service across every area of our business.”   Ron, who was joined in Berlin by his son Daniel, the company’s Operations Director, added: “At S & B we prefer to focus on our shortcomings, rather than celebrating our successes. So while we are all very proud of this award, there is still much to be done to improve our customer service and no-one will be resting on any laurels.”     S & B Commercials sells and supports the award-winning Mercedes-Benz truck and van ranges, as well as popular Fuso Canter light trucks. Despite a depressed market it enjoyed a spectacularly good sales year in 2010, supplying some 2,500 vehicles – including 200 new trucks and around 350 pre-owned units – to fleet and retail customers.   On the after sales side, meanwhile, S & B scores highly on all of the criteria, including Service24h emergency roadside rescue and recovery response times, first time pass rates for vehicles prepared in its workshops for MoT tests, and parts stockholding and availability, which together make up its Mercedes-Benz Customer Service Index ranking.      Robin Bray role took up his current role with S & B 12 years ago and was the first winner of the Business Manager of the Year award, when it was introduced in 2004. “We made the most of some aggressive finance campaigns by Mercedes-Benz and did very well in terms of improved finance penetration performance,” he said. “It’s refreshing and gratifying to see one’s contribution recognised in this way.”   Graham Balsom joined S & B a year after Robin and was also Mercedes-Benz Van Sales Manager of the Year in 2005. “We sold 1,600 new vans last year which was a great result given the difficult trading conditions,” confirmed Graham, who leads a team of eight light commercial vehicle sales specialists.   Ian Jones of Mercedes-Benz UK commented: “S & B plays a lead role within our commercial vehicle network. It has made significant private investments in customer support facilities in the north and east M25 corridor over recent years, and its dedication to the Mercedes-Benz brand is second to none. To win MB Dealer of the Year requires excellence in all aspects of their performance – and S & B delivered.”       Winners... S & B’s Robin Bray and Graham Balsom, right in both pictures, collect their awards from Steve Durrant of Mercedes-Benz Financial Services and Simon Neil of Mercedes-Benz Vans

Currently Mercedes-Benz are offering a 'swappage' scheme, which I've written about before. This basically offers potential Sprinter and Vito owners low rate finance. Those choosing to take that finance also benefit from a substantial deposit contribution from Mercedes-Benz on the finance deal. Potential Sprinter buyers also benefit from Free Servicing. So, by way of illustration, if you had a scrappage qualifying vehicle to trade in against a new Sprinter, you can benefit from:
  • £1000 Government Scrappage allowance
  • £2000 Swappage deposit contribution

When you look at the substantial savings that way, buying a new Mercedes Sprinter or Mercedes Vito is even more attractive.

item.title: Keep illuminated in the Winter Nights with our Mercedes Parts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The clocks are going back in a couple of weeks and as nights draw in early, it's important to make sure that your Mercedes Van or Truck is illuminated correctly. Stone chips and parking bumps to your lights and lenses may have occurred during the summer months and you've been putting off getting them fixed, but now is the time to do it when you've still got the daylight to see what your doing! Your van must be illuminated correctly at night for safety reasons and must be MOT legal at all times of the year. S&B Commercials have a wide range of Mercedes Parts in their online store including Lights and Lenses for Mercedes Vito, Sprinter and Atego 814 and 815 trucks. If your in need of any of these lenses, or indeed any other parts, you'll be sure to find them in our store and at a great price too. Keep Safe.

There is another story of an high achieving employee called Vito who helped sway the decision but basically its a shortened version of Vitoria. Our trusty Vito's have been around since 1996 making them 15 years old this year. They have served businesses from all sectors and have been used as Security Vehicles, Royal transport and Ambulances. This here is the 2nd Generation Vito Sport. It has a 3.0l petrol V6 engine that produces 204 bhp. The Vito comes in 3 different lengths and 4 different engine specs. One being the above Vito Sport and the others are specced from a 2.2 litre diesel engine. The lengths depend on which Vito you choose to have. There is the standard panel-van and there are also the Dualiner and Traveliner offering more space and headroom for those larger tasks. Over this coming year Mercedes have been producing the Vito E-Cell which is 100% driven by electricity. The plans are to make a small number first to see how they fare, personally I think they will do well. So there we have it - A brief story of our popular Vito van. Its origins and where it is heading. I hope you found this interesting and many thanks for reading.

item.title: What is Adblue and why do we use it?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Hello Everyone, Have you ever wondered why some trucks and vans use a fluid called Adblue? Adblue is the more common name given to a substance called Aqueous Urea Solution. This solution helps in the process of reducing the oxides and harmful emissions that come out of the exhaust of a diesel engine. The solution makes up a part of what is called SCR or Selective Catalytic Reduction which is now becoming the standard for all modern day Vans and Trucks to adhere to. This has been implemented all over europe and many other countries and will be implemented in the US over the coming years. If you need Adblue or want to find your nearest supplier then check this locator link to assist you in finding one. item.title: Mercedes Vans and Trucks.. When did it all start?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Good morning, I hope this will be an enjoyable Friday for everyone. At S&B Commercials we sell and service Mercedes Benz Vans and Trucks. As I write to you everyday, I like to tell you a little about some of our products and services but today, I am going to tell you about our core product here at S&B Commercials, The Mercedes Benz Van. Well where do I start, Mercedes Benz have been pioneers in many parts of the motoring industry what with developing the very first petrol engine and gaining the patent for that in 1886. But I want to talk about vans so that would bring me to the 1955 L319 Mercedes Benz van. This van was a product of the earlier L-3500 Truck. Influenced by the Volkswagen panel-van, Mercedes Benz saw opportunity after producing a van for military purposes to then go on and use this for Commercial purposes, hence the birth of the L319. With a 43bhp engine with a load capacity of 1.5-2.0 tonnes and a selection of bodies to choose from, this agile van was perfect for the commercial domain. The L319 enjoyed a long life of 13 years before being replaced with the T2 van in 1968. Figures well over 100,000 show that the overall sales of the L319 were successful and certainly paved the way for us all to have our Vito's and Sprinters today. So thats where it all started. S&B Commercials would not be able to supply New and Used Mercedes Benz vans and trucks whilst also supplying genuine mercedes parts if it wasn't for the infamous L319 van from 1955. I hope you enjoyed todays article and may I wish you all a lovely weekend.

item.title: What type of oil should I use for my Mercedes Benz Van?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: There are a few different types of oil with various ratings and numbers and letters attached to it. It may be synthetic or semi-synthetic. All this can be confusing when all you want is to put some oil in your engine. Well I will try and explain a little bit so that you can make the right choice. For your Mercedes Benz Vito or Sprinter you are best to use 10w-40 or 15w-40 grade oil. All oil that you buy will have one of these types of ratings on it and what it means is this, 10w-40. The 2 numbers represents the low and high viscosity of the oil. Viscosity basically means thickness. The 10w is the viscosity at 0 degrees C and the 40 is the viscosity at 100 degrees C. The "w" next to the 10 means that it has been winter tested. There is a polymer additive combined with the oil to keep it thinner in the extreme cold and thicker in the heat which in turn will help you engine wear. So in winter you can put in 10w-40 or maybe even 5w-30 if it is really cold but in the UK 10w-40 will suffice. In the summer you could maybe think about putting 15w-40 in your engine as it generally is a thicker oil and the natural heat of the summer keeps it thinner. This is exactly why the oil is rated the way it is. Synthetic oil has been tampered with by us humans to make an even more efficient oil for our engines, also explaining why it is more expensive. A few synthesised components used in the making of petroleum are used to help make the oil rather than manufactured solely from crude oil. Mineral oil is also an option but it is a by-product of making petroleum and was once only used as a mechanical lubricant. Now it is mass produced and being sold world wide as a motor oil. While it is OK, fully synthetic oil will help you with engine wear and you will get a more full and consistent protection from your oil. Again if you have a Mercedes Benz Vito or Sprinter then use Synthetic 10w-40 oil. So there we go. I hope this has helped you in making your oil decision. At S&B Commercials we sell oil literally by the drum. SO if you would like to buy either 1 litre or 100 litres then contact us here. Just to remind you also that S&B Commercials will not only supply you with some oil. We will also put it in your van, service your van, repair your van or even sell you a new or used van. We have many New and Used Mercedes Vans and Trucks which are viewable on our website so go have a look when you get a spare minute. item.title: The New Mercedes Benz Vito.
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
As you may already know, Mercedes Benz have released a new Vito for 2011.

The ever popular van has been given a facelift and a new 4-cylinder diesel engine which comes with a few different power outputs. There are new comfort and safety features which are compulsory for a new Mercedes Benz vehicle of any sort and the Vito certainly did not miss out.

One of the major changes is the new engines. These engines have been tested to EU5/111 emissions standards requirements and have been proven to use less fuel than its predecessor while reducing even more exhaust emissions. The new range comes in the form of a 2.14 litre turbo diesel engine and a 3.0 litre v6 turbo diesel. This is how they rate, 110 cdi - 2.14 litre with 95 bhp producing 250 torques using an ECO-Gear 6 speed manual transmission giving you around 37 mpg. 113 cdi - 2.14 litre with 136 bhp producing 310 torques using an ECO-Gear 6 speed manual transmission giving you around 38 mpg. 116 cdi - 2.14 litre with 163 bhp producing 360 torques using an ECO-Gear 6 speed manual transmission giving you around 37 mpg. 122 cdi - 3.0 v6 with 224 bhp producing 440 torques using an NAG WSA 380 5 speed automatic transmission giving you 32 mpg. So as you can see the new engines are environmentally friendly, powerful and economical. I would also like to add that the 113 cdi and 116 cdi also comes with the option to have the automatic transmission. All of the new engines  can have what is called BlueEFFICIENCY fitted to help reduce fuel costs and emissions by giving you some clever technology. The new safety features cover all the new models of Vito also. There is an all new ADAPTIVE ESP or Electronic Stability Program which, also gives a more comfortable experience, new airbags, larger tail lights, bi-xenon headlamps, disk brakes all round, tyre pressure monitor(optional), three point seat belts and many more optional extras. From these points alone it is easy to see why the Vito is going to be a strong competitor for all vans in 2011 and beyond. So its also a good thing that S&B Commercials will be selling the new Vito as well as all other Mercedes Benz Commercials Vehicles. item.title: My new Vito has ESP, EBD, SOA... What do these mean exactly?
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: It is standard now when you buy a new Mercedes van there is many three letter abbreviations that give us a shortened description of the vehicles features. We are all used to a few of them like PAS(Power Assisted Steering) or E/W(Electric Windows) because they have been around for some time now. Whilst these and a few others still remain, more new and exciting systems are being designed by Mercedes Benz which you will find on its newer vans.  The new Vito for example which is fully loaded with new technology. These new systems have been shortened down to their very own abbreviated version. Some of them you may never have seen before so here is an explanation of Mercedes Benz' innovative new technologies. ESP - Adaptive ESP as it is known, means Electronic Stability Program. This is a fully dynamic handling system that takes the vehicles load into account. Very intelligent stuff. It intervenes in certain hazardous driving conditions or when you have to brake suddenly. Adaptive ESP is in constant communication with all of the other technologies fitted in the vehicle. EBD - Electronic Brake-force Distribution. This dynamically distributes braking forces between the front and rear of the vehicle. BAS - Braking Assist. This works in conjunction with your ABS(anti-lock Brake) to assist the driver in gaining the brakes full potential if needed. SOA - Start off assist. For fully laden and uphill starts. ASR - Acceleration skid control. This kicks in at the first sign of a wheel spin. The system automatically reduces engine power and applies the correct brake to rectify the spin. ESPTSA - This is a compliment to the afore mentioned Adaptive ESP. It is a trailer stability assistance program for when you need to tow. So there we have it. Some of the new technologies from Mercedes Benz. At S&B Commercials we are proud to pass these benefits to you to help your driving experience and keep you even safer on the road. item.title: Check out our finance options at S&B Commercials
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: At S&B Commercials we endeavour to be able to offer you the best range of services available. Our finance packages are no different. We work in partnership with Mercedes Benz CharterWay. This is Mercedes Benz's own financial packages and services range to help you on your way to owning a Mercedes Benz Commercial vehicle or Mitsubishi Canter. You can choose a simple hire purchase agreement or negotiate a contract lease for a number of Mercedes vans. Lets have a look at a couple of packages in a little more detail so you can see just how much S&B commercials can help you obtain the finance you need. The Agility Package - This is a fantastic package that gives you flexibility throughout the loan term.  When you buy your van with this package, you would need to place a deposit at the start of the agreed term. Then a set of low monthly payments would be agreed. The monthly payments have the ability to remain low due to the lump sun that would be agreed to pay at the end of the term. So basically it is lump sum at the beginning, low monthly payments for an agreed term then a lump sum at the end.  Here is the good bit - So you have paid your deposit and you have come to the end of your repayments, as stated you can pay off a final lump sum OR you can choose to spread this final payment out over another agreed term or you can choose to simply give the vehicle back to us with no hassle. You may even be able to trade the vehicle in for a newer one. All in all this is a great package with options and versatility where you need it most. Operating Lease - This is a simple way of obtaining a Mercedes Benz vehicle. Basically a vehicle is hired for you for an agreed amount of time. You pay monthly for the vehicle, the payments are forecast based on the general depreciation of the vehicle and the agreed milage you will cover in the van. This means that you will not need a large initial deposit, then at the end of the payments you give the vehicle back. Simple. When you agree a vehicle that you would like to lease, we will agree a milage allowance for the vehicle over the period of the term. The only extra charges you may incur are for going over the agreed milage limit or damage outside general wear and tear. You can choose to pay monthly or even quarterly. This is strictly a leasing package and the option of owning the vehicle is not part of the contract. So there we have a couple of the many finance packages the S&B Commercials can offer you to help your business get mobile now. To see these  services in even further detail and to check the other options out then click here to see our finance section on our website. There is an interactive table at the bottom of the page so you can see the packages in full. If you would like to know more about financing but would rather talk to someone then you can call us direct here or you can contact our Group Business Manager directly. His name is Robin Bray and he has over 30 years experience in the finance sector. He would be delighted to hear from you, so please give him a call and get the expert advice you can trust. item.title: Why use Shell Rimula Oil for your Mercedes Sprinter or Vito?
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Shell Rimula R6 LM Low SAP Oil is the recommended engine oil for Mercedes Sprinters and Vitos with Euro 4 & 5 engines. The Euro 4 & 5 engines are fitted with Diesel Particulate Traps on the exhaust pipe to meet current emissions legislation.  The Diesel Particulate Traps work to reduce the vehicles emissions by effectively cleaning the exhaust gas before it is released into the atmosphere. The Shell Rimula R6 LM Low SAP Oil has been designed specifically to be used in Euro 4 & 5 engines.  Using the wrong type of oil in your Mercedes Van could invalidate your vehicle's warranty, and could also cause damage to your vehicle's engine.  In order to prevent this happening to our customers, S & B Commercials have teamed up with Shell to provide our customers with the right engine oil at the right price! Buying your 1litre Shell Rimula R6 top-up oil for £9.99 (ex VAT) at S & B Commercials will not only give you peace of mind that you are using the right engine oil for your Mercedes Van, but you will also receive a free Top-Up kit bag! We can also provide you with Shell Rimula oil in larger quantities, please contact you local S & B Commercials Parts department to discuss your requirements.

item.title: London Low Emission Zone - Are you compliant?
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Time is running out to ensure your Commercial Vehicle is compliant to the new London LEZ standards. Once the LEZ changescome into effect on January 3rd 2012, any non-compliant vehicle will be charged at least  £100 a day to enter the Zone.  Failure to register your vehicle could result in a £1000 fine! If your vehicle is currently non-compliant, you have four options:
  • Have a diesel particulate filter fitted to your vehicle, to bring it up to Euro 3 (Van) or Euro 4 (Truck) standards
  • Replace your vehicle with an LEZ compliant vehicle
  • Register your vehicle and pay the LEZ £100/£200 daily charge (van/truck)
  • Pay £1000 fine!
Click here to see how S & B Commercials can help you with the first two options.

item.title: Protect your catalytic-converter from thieves!
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Catalytic-converter theft is on the increase due the soaring price of  precious metals!  Catalytic-converters can be stolen in just 60 secs and could end up costing upwards of £1000 to replace, not to mention the inconvenience of having your van off the road!  ArmaCat is a cost effective way of preventing this. ArmaCatis designed to deter thieves, by effectively clamping the catalytic-converter.  This means without specialist tools it will take a lot of time, effort and noise to remove a catalytic-converter with an ArmaCat fitted. Contact S & B Commercials to arrange having ArmaCat fitted to your Mercedes-Benz Sprinter or Vito: - Hatfield - Stansted - Thurrock -

item.title: Driver CPC Training - What's it all about?
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Driver Certificate of Professional Competence (Driver CPC) is part of a European legislation, designed to improve road safety.  All professional bus, coach and lorry drivers must now hold a Driver CPC in addition to their vocational licence, and they must complete 35hours of periodic training every five years. CPC DriverTraining is the Mercedes-Benz training course for professional drivers, take a look at our website for more information.  Alternatively click here to download our Complete Guide to the Driver CPC. item.title: Mercedes-Benz add the Antos to their current range
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes commercial vehicles are at the forefront of the UK’s logistics distribution network, with their Axor and Actros models gaining plaudits from operators nationwide. However there’s a new Mercedes truck which is aiming to find its own place in their wide range of vehicle – the Antos.
The Mercedes-Benz Antos HGV is due to make its debut at the IAA Commercial Vehicles show in Hanover in September, it’s been aimed at “heavy-duty, short-radius distribution transport,” use and Mercedes hope that it will take the 18 tonne distribution market by storm.
The Mercedes website says that the truck is perfect for retail services, grocery transport or even tanker and dry-bulk haulage and with all-new practical and comfortable cabs and Euro 6 engines, it’s sure to be a winner from the start.
Mercedes-Benz engineers have added a streamlined cab to the Antos to help fuel efficiency. And with reduced rolling resistance and lower emission Euro 6 engines combined with Mercedes’ new exhaust technology the new Antos will take you past the new 2014 emissions standard with ease.
Hauliers can choose from a range of engines starting at 238 bhp up to 510 bhp and there are an astonishing 67 different wheelbase lengths to choose from. Other variants include the Antos Loader which is built for hauling heavy cargo and the Antos Volumer which has an enhanced cargo capacity.
The Mercedes-Benz Antos is a new class of truck in heavy-duty distribution and is sure to turn a few heads at Mercedes dealers when they start to take delivery later this year.

item.title: Hilton Rental adds Mercedes-Benz Sprinter to its fleet
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Run by entrepreneur, Peter Hilton, Hilton Rental offers a wide range of different vehicles for hire, including sports cars, 4x4s and wedding cars. The firm is now adding the Mercedes-Benz Sprinter to its fleet thanks to S & B Commercials. Hilton considers himself a Mercedes-Benz enthusiast and many of his businesses are influenced by the brand. Having started a car body repair business from his parents’ garage 25 years ago, he now runs an accident repair centre and a classic car retailer as well as his new hire car firm. Vehicle Rental Manager Adam Sydes said:
"These are still early days but we're getting busier by the day and are very excited about the potential for growth of our new venture. "We've already seen a lot of demand for our new Sprinter - it's proving particularly popular with private customers undertaking their own house or office moves, as well as for retailers and couriers needing an additional vehicle for a short period during a particularly busy time."
The Sprinter comes with a three-year manufacturer’s warranty with unlimited mileage, offering great peace of mind to anyone who invests in one.

item.title: Suffolk police warn lorry drivers not to spend too long at the wheel
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Recent figures have revealed that there have been 698 tachograph offences in Suffolk in the last two years. Fitted to all heavy goods vehicles, tachographs record the number of hours driving each day, including drivers’ breaks from the wheel. Suffolk police currently fine drivers for tachograph offences. In 2010, there were 286 tickets and in 2011, that number rose to 412. A police spokesman said:
“There are spot checks carried out by roads policing officers at various locations – these can be pre-planned or spontaneous checks where a patrolling officer will stop an HGV to check over for tacho and other offences. “We also work with our partners in VOSA (Vehicle and Operator Services Agency) and facilitate larger checks such as Operation Mermaid, which is a national campaign involving several other agencies such as VOSA and as well as Customs and the Health and Safety Executive.”
Drivers are able to drive for nine hours a day with two ten-hour days each week. However, they must take 45 minute breaks after every 4.5 hour period and they must not exceed 56 hours in a week. VOSA approved tachograph centres provide calibration and repairs to ensure businesses remain compliant.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Actros truck wins Red Dot design award
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes-Benz has been producing the Actros since 1995 and it has established itself as being many people’s first choice for long distance haulage. Powered by V6 or V8 diesel engines, the trucks offer unparalleled performance, but their design has also been recognised. The Red Dot Design Awards saw international experts judge 4,500 different products in terms of innovation, aesthetics and pioneering design. The panel said of the Actros:
"What is important is a durable and functional design idiom that continues to look appealing and modern for years to come. The new Actros balances function with perfect exterior form."
The firm’s commercial vehicle design director, Kai Sieber, echoed that sentiment when confirming that form and function were a focus when developing the vehicle. This was further supported by the fact that Mercedes-Benz released ‘Dimensions’ to coincide with the new Actros. This publication presented the vehicle as a design object with beautiful photographs and innovative editorial layout. Bizarrely, Dimensions itself was the recipient of a Red Dot award in the Magazines and Daily Press category. Both awards continue a rich tradition for the Actros, which was also awarded with a Red Dot when first launched in 1998.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Citan to be promoted at Serie B games in Italy
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes-Benz’s new city van, the Citan, will be promoted during Serie B games in Italy after becoming an official partner of the league – Italy’s second division. The one-season deal means the Citan brand has visual rights at every game as the league has a centralised sponsorship model. Dario Albano, from Mercedes-Benz Italy’s vans sales division, said that the partnership underlined the firm’s close sporting links. Andrew Abodi, the president of Serie B, said:
“Mercedes-Benz is a prestigious global brand that has chosen the Serie B platform as an anchor in the field of football and clearly acknowledges the platforms ability to represent positive values. We are very proud, this choice by the German company demonstrates the appeal of our championship - thanks to the passion of the fans as well as the work of the management and the staff at all 22 clubs.”
The Citan is a small, front wheel drive, urban delivery van. The name isn’t actually a blend of ‘city’ and ‘van’ as you might think, but of ‘city’ and ‘titan’. Mercdes-Benz is aiming to sell 400,000 before the end of 2015.

item.title: Iraq takes delivery of 250 Mercedes-Benz trucks
item.dc:creator: rsedgwick
item.content:encoded:
Iraq’s State Company for Automotive Industry (SCAI) has recently taken delivery of 250 Mercedes-Benz Actros trucks. The vehicles are to be used to assist in reconstruction efforts within the country. A heavy-duty truck, the Actros is generally used for long distance haulage. Hubertus Troska, the head of Mercedes-Benz Trucks, said the trucks would be ideal for the SCAI’s purposes:
"Our vehicles are perfect for use in rough terrain, where they clearly demonstrate their quality and reliability.”
Mercedes-Benz have never before supplied trucks to SCAI, although the agreement between Daimler and SCAI was signed in February 2010 in Baghdad – Mercedes-Benz is a division of Daimler AG. Manufactured at the Mercedes-Benz facility in Worth in Germany – a plant that has been in operation since 1965 – the 250 Actros were delivered as complete vehicles, but will be equipped for various construction purposes by SCAI before being put into operation. The 250 vehicles consist of 100 Actros 3331K dump truck chassis and then 150 Actros 3340S tractors which can be used for carrying water or fuel tanks, or for similar semi-trailers. Both types feature V6 engines with a 16-speed gearbox.

item.title: Improving the fuel consumption of your fleet
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
Haulage vehicles such as the Mercedes-Benz Actros are designed for maximum fuel efficiency. Trucks are heavy and do high mileage, so fuel consumption is a major concern. Small improvements can add up to large savings for firms with large fleets.
By the same token, other small changes can also have an impact. Fuel consumption is not a constant. It varies depending on various factors. Having an economical engine is just one of these.
Another thing to look at is tyre pressure. As well as potentially being dangerous, insufficiently inflated tyres also increase rolling resistance, which will increase fuel consumption. Wind resistance has the same effect, so fleet operators should always ensure wind deflectors are correctly adjusted.
It is also important to consider how the vehicle is driven. It takes a lot of energy to get a heavy vehicle moving, so acceleration uses a lot of fuel. Sometimes, it isn’t necessary to accelerate if you are only going to have to decelerate again shortly afterwards. Educating drivers about this can help ensure further fuel savings.
It is worth bearing all of these things in mind, because a vehicle with good fuel economy is a cost effective vehicle and it is also more environmentally friendly.

item.title: Managing a fleet using vehicle tracking software
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
If your firm operates a fleet of vehicles, you will probably make use of some form of tracking software. There are many benefits, although some are more obvious than others.
The most significant benefit is simply that you know where all your vehicles are at any given moment. No matter what your industry, this is hugely advantageous. If you need to reschedule drivers’ routes to quickly respond to a particular customer’s needs then being aware of which vehicle is closest is hugely beneficial. In some industries, it would be all but impossible to operate without such technology.
However, there are secondary benefits to vehicle tracking software which aren’t so obvious. As well as providing real-time information about vehicles’ whereabouts, such software also builds a history of your fleet. This is useful because it allows you to easily monitor how much mileage each van or truck is doing and you can therefore schedule servicing and maintenance before problems have a chance to develop.
With accurate records for all vehicles in your fleet, you can make the most of a service contract and ensure that no vehicle goes too long without being looked at.

item.title: Some factors affecting fuel consumption
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: When operating a fleet of vehicles, fuel consumption is a major concern. The more fuel the fleet uses, the greater its impact on the environment and the more it costs to run. Here are just a few of the factors which influence the fuel consumption of a vehicle. The engine An efficient engine is one of the most significant influences on overall fuel consumption. Some engines are intrinsically more efficient than others, but it is also true that a poorly maintained engine will require more fuel, so schedule regular servicing to ensure your vehicles are in peak condition. The powertrain The key here is to ensure your vehicle is set up correctly for the way in which it will be used. A vehicle which does a lot of steady motorway miles will need a different setup from one doing shorter trips at lower speed. Rolling and wind resistance Poor aerodynamics increase drag, while insufficiently inflated tyres will also lead to greater fuel consumption – not to mention the fact that they could prove dangerous. Driver behaviour Frequent acceleration and deceleration increase fuel usage and it is also worth trying to reduce idling time as this means fuel is being used for no real purpose.

item.title: Belfast removals company opts for Mercedes-Benz Atego
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Belfast firm, Coastways Storage and Removals, has ordered new Mercedes-Benz Ategos, two of which will feature both box and curtainside bodies. A curtain on one side will allow for easy access and loading by forklift, while the opposite side will be rigid, allowing for items to be stacked against it for transportation. Coastways’ director, Dominic Murray, says that the unusual configuration provides the perfect combination for the firm’s needs. A third Atego has also been acquired with a standard box body. Murray went on to say:
"We used to run various makes of vehicle, but experience proved that the Mercedes lasted better and were more dependable, while the support we've received from our local dealer, particularly in terms of parts availability, has always been excellent. "This is crucial because around 70 per cent of our work is done with containers, so if one of our vehicles is off the road we can't simply go out and spot hire a box van to replace it. Our latest trucks are also being inspected and maintained by Mercedes-Benz Truck and Van, and it's reassuring to know that the dealer appreciates why we need them turned around very quickly."
The Atego meets Euro 5 emissions limits and is known for its fuel economy. Murray says the firm has already noticed an improvement in terms of fuel consumption.

item.title: Distribution company reports improved fuel consumption thanks to Actros
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Welwyn Garden City-based logistics firm, PW Gates Distribution, has said that fuel consumption has dropped by more than seven per cent since it turned to Mercedes-Benz Actros trucks for its fleet. The Actros is well-known for its great fuel consumption, even earning itself a world record a few years ago. PW Gates added two 2545LS models featuring BigSpace sleeper cabs to its fleet of 32 trucks, each capable of producing 450hp. Development director, Chris Lynch, said:
"The fleet average on this work is around 9mpg, and sometimes a little bit less. By contrast, our two New Actros are in the high nines. "Whereas previously you'd have to put at least 50,000km on a truck before you started to see an improvement in fuel economy, these Mercedes are still only a couple of weeks old."
The vehicles have been acquired on a two-year contract hire agreement. Lynch says it is a great deal because it also includes repair and maintenance. This makes for more accurate budgets as the potential for surprises is minimised.

item.title: International Truck of the Year 2011 – the Mercedes-Benz Atego
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
It is no mean feat to earn the title ‘International Truck of the Year 2011’. Vehicles are assessed according to a number of criteria and the winner can’t fall down anywhere. That is why the Mercedes-Benz Atego is such a popular truck.
One of the main selling points is that there is a diesel-electric model on offer. It is rare for factory-built environmentally friendly options to be available, but the Atego can be acquired with the Atego BlueTec Hybrid engine. A stop-start system further reduces fuel consumption as well as minimising engine wear and tear.
It is also a pleasure to use. A spacious cab ensures comfort for the crew and an air-sprung suspension seat can be requested for both the driver’s and passenger’s side. This ensures better posture through adjustable lumbar support.
The dashboard features chrome rings and a graphics display with an easy to comprehend menu system. The instrument panel displays vital information at all times and can display messages and trailer data as well. The rev counter is also designed in such a way as to encourage fuel savings through more efficient driving habits.
On top of all of this, there is the simple fact that it has been carefully designed for distribution and construction use, which is of course its greatest strength.

item.title: Haulage firm looks for fuel savings after purchasing six Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
UK haulage, warehousing and distribution firm, Andyfreight, anticipates it will benefit from an eight per cent reduction in fuel consumption after purchasing six Mercedes-Benz Actros trucks. The 2545 models feature StreamSpace cabs and 450hp engines which are said to average around 9.3mpg when carrying out general haulage work. Managing director Andy Pountney said:
“Over the course of a full year it is going to save us up to £5,000 per unit in diesel costs.”
The Actros was voted Truck of the Year 2009 and is available with a range of cabs and made to different specifications depending on the intended usage. It is also commonly used for distribution and in the construction industry, but its fuel consumption makes it ideal for long distance work. On journeys that might take days or even weeks, the impact can really be seen. The vehicle’s strength is highlighted by the fact that in 2008 the Actros managed to achieve a world record for fuel efficiency – an average of 12.39 miles per gallon while hauling a 25 ton payload.

item.title: Don’t lose business resulting from vehicle faults
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
If you rely on your van or truck for carrying out your work, you need to guarantee that it will always be up and running. If there is any kind of a fault and it is kept off the road, you will be unable to work. This means losing money, but it could also mean losing customers if you miss appointments.
In order to prevent this, you should ensure you have a service contract. Regular servicing will ensure your vehicle remains in good working order and should minimise the chances of your suffering a breakdown.
Of course, in order that your vehicle can be serviced, it will need to be off the road for a period of time, but at least you can schedule this and reorganise your appointments accordingly. You could try and time it for when you are planning a day off, or it is even possible to have work carried out overnight. You can simply drop off the van at the end of one working day and then pick it up again the following morning. This means no disruption to your work, but complete peace of mind regarding the state of your vehicle.

item.title: The Mercedes-Benz Atego offers comfort as well as performance
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
The Mercedes-Benz Atego was awarded the title of ‘International Truck of the Year 2011’ but what does a vehicle have to offer in order to be recognised in this way?
For a start, the Atego provides both agility and reliability. It is primarily intended for local distribution and construction site work and has been designed accordingly. As a result, it is both robust and efficient.
The Atego offers more features than other vehicles in its class and can be configured according to individual needs. There is also a factory-built diesel-electric version, so it is that much easier to consider the environment.
The truck itself is manoeuvrable, economical and durable, but it is also comfortable. If a sleeper cab is required, then the sleeping space also incorporates 300L of additional space under the bed, meaning the driver has somewhere to keep much-needed items for the journey.
The bed itself features a single mattress with a sprung core, which should ensure a good night’s sleep. A side wall control panel allows the user to control lighting, heating and the alarm clock.

item.title: Why service contracts make so much sense
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
Whether you run just one van or a whole fleet of vehicles, service contracts are hugely advantageous. By having your vehicle or vehicles regularly looked at, you can rest assured that they will operate as well as they did when new. A service contract provides reliability and ensures good performance and fuel economy.
Many people don’t see the benefit in having their vehicle serviced. If it is going to be off the road, what does it matter if it is scheduled or if it happens as a result of a breakdown? Aside from the obvious answer that a breakdown is more disruptive and may have an impact on your clients, there is also the fact that a service can be scheduled for a convenient time. If you are self-employed, you can have your van serviced while you are on holiday, or it is even possible to have it done overnight.
There are different levels of service contract and the cost will depend on the vehicle, how it is used and the annual mileage. Contracts will also be reviewed each year to ensure you are not overpaying.

item.title: The Mercedes-Benz Atego’s hybrid system
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
The Mercedes-Benz Atego BlueTec Hybrid is the first European mass production hybrid drive truck and it has now been delivered to over a hundred customers since it was released two years ago. Its popularity is in large part based on being a more environmentally friendly option and thanks to the fuel savings that result. The use of a hybrid Atego shows a firm’s environmental awareness, but the economic advantages are significant too. Klotz, a German haulage firm says that fuel savings can be as much as 12 per cent for urban deliveries around Freiburg compared to another truck of similar weight. Manager, Bernard Klotz, also points out:
"One day fossil fuel supplies and natural resources will come to an end. Everyone knows this is the case and that is why we must all do something."
The hybrid Atego features a four-cylinder diesel engine producing 218hp and a water-cooled electric motor producing 60hp. Both run simultaneously, but when the batteries are sufficiently charged, the diesel engine will run only at idle speed, kicking in only when needed for additional power.

item.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger invests in Mercedes truck
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
Being one of the biggest Hollywood stars and a former governor of California, what would you expect Arnold Schwarzenegger to drive? A flash sports car, perhaps? Or maybe you imaging his being chauffeured around in a luxury limo. Well, the truth is that he is currently driving a Mercedes-Benz monster truck. The giant silver Unimog, which has been adapted for street use, cost him around a quarter of a million dollars. Ordinarily, it is a military vehicle. As well as fire-fighting, haulage and a number of other tasks, Mercedes-Benz list winter roads maintenance as one of the vehicle’s main uses.
“Winter roads maintenance, including salt spreaders, snow ploughs and snow blowers, is a vital service for all road users. The Mercedes-Benz Unimog incorporates the latest technology, plus rugged reliability, to provide a practical and cost-effective solution in the most difficult weather conditions.”
You can’t imagine that being a key consideration for Schwarzenegger in sunny Los Angeles, unless he’s got his sights set on a new career clearing airport runways.

item.title: Ensuring vehicle efficiency when managing a fleet
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded: Fleet management is to a large degree about ensuring efficiency. Transportation costs are significant, but small changes implemented across an entire fleet can lead to significant savings for a firm. Wise investment The first step in the process is to ensure your company purchases the right vehicles for the job. Key considerations are fuel efficiency and capacity, but there will be many seemingly minor options available which will have an impact on those two major priorities. It may also be worth investing in different sizes of vehicle for greater flexibility. Intelligent management If you have the option, deploying a smaller, lighter vehicle will result in fuel savings. There is also a lot that can be done through intelligent route planning. Sudden changes cannot always be avoided, but fleet management software can help you react quickly in the best way possible. Servicing By having vans and trucks regularly serviced, you achieve two things. You ensure that they are running efficiently, reducing fuel costs and you also minimise the likelihood of one suffering a breakdown. The latter scenario can have a huge impact on the work being carried out that day as well as bringing unwanted repair costs.

item.title: Cutting fuel consumption with the Actros
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
A new driver assistance system developed by Bosch is to be used in Mercedes-Benz Actros trucks. The manufacturer says its use means that average fuel consumption can be reduced by around three per cent for heavy trucks.
The system makes use of GPS and vehicle data to ensure the vehicle is operated more efficiently. The ‘predictive powertrain control’ was jointly developed with Mercedes-Benz, while another key element is the firm’s Eco.Logic motion assistance technology. This takes into account gradients and corners and in combination with fuel consumption algorithms then optimises engine performance accordingly.
The three per cent fuel reduction figure is dependent on several factors, not least the topography of the route. However, even a one per cent drop for a heavy truck can lead to massive savings over the course of a year, particularly when those savings are then applied to an entire fleet.
In 2008, the Mercedes-Benz Actros set a fuel efficiency world record, so further measures in this regard will ensure it remains one of the most popular haulage vehicles in the world.

item.title: Making use of the right vehicles
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
Any firm operating a large fleet can make huge savings through seemingly minor changes in working practices. Sophisticated GPS tracking software might seem prohibitively expensive, but the impact it has on the way the fleet is managed can save an enormous amount of fuel over the course of a year, leading to huge savings for the firm. Another major aspect of fleet efficiency revolves around the vehicles being used. If they are not suitable for the job, your business is essentially wasting money.
When investing in a new vehicle, it is worth paying just as much attention to fuel efficiency as anything else. Multiply one vehicle’s daily mileage by the number of vehicles in the fleet and by all the working days in the year and you can easily see how small savings add up.
However, new purchases are rare. Chances are you already have a fleet of vehicles and you are more concerned with managing them. Here too, you can have an impact. If you have a range of different vans and trucks in your fleet, ensure the most appropriate ones are being used for each task. For example, it is grossly inefficient to use a large van for local deliveries if it is half-empty and there is a smaller vehicle available that is sitting unused.

item.title: Improving fleet efficiency and productivity
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
At the most basic level, managing a fleet is simply about getting the job done. This may involve collection and delivery of goods, either between different businesses or from retailers to customers; or it might mean ensuring people arrive at a particular location in order to provide a service.
As long as these goals are met promptly, your customers or clients are likely to be content. However, this is not the end of the matter in terms of the impact on your business. In reality, there are many ways of managing a fleet and doing so effectively will save money, making the business more profitable.
One of the major outgoings for any firm running a large fleet of vehicles is fuel. Petrol and diesel have been getting more and more expensive, so mileage and vehicle efficiency are key considerations.
Satellite navigation systems and intelligently planned routes will minimise travelling time, but it’s also possible to save significant sums through ensuring that you are using the right vehicles and by having them regularly serviced so that they are in optimal working order. As well as ensuring improved mileage per gallon, servicing will also minimise breakdowns and the related costs.

item.title: The urban delivery van from Mercedes-Benz
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Delivery vehicles come in many different sizes and shapes from large trucks intended for haulage right down to far smaller vehicles, barely any bigger than a conventional car, which can be used in urban environment. The Mercedes-Benz Citan is the latter.
It is designed to be an efficient vehicle. Capable of 65.7mpg it uses less fuel and produces fewer emissions than any similar vehicle. This is despite being able to carry up to 800kg. The petrol and diesel versions are available with Merces-Benz’s BlueEFFICIENCY package, which incorporates stop-start technology. In short, the engine is temporarily cut when speed drops below 5mph, kicking in again seamlessly when needed.
Although it is intended for transportation of goods, the driver and passenger are considered as well. Seats feature durable, breathable covers, while backrests provide good support. It also features an anti-lock braking system, traction control and an acceleration skid control system for safety.
In short, it is a vehicle built to typical Mercedes-Benz standards, offering great efficiency should you need a small and versatile commercial vehicle. The Citan seems set for huge success upon its release.

item.title: Arthur Spriggs and Sons orders rigid Actros variant
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes-Benz have said that Gloucestershire haulage firm, Arthur Spriggs and Sons is the first in the country to order a rigid variant of the new Actros. The 26-tonne rigid variant is to be used for general deliveries and will operate from the firm’s Tewkesbury base. Chris Spriggs, the firm’s director of operations, said:
“It's an absolutely marvellous truck. The fuel returns are already good and getting better by the week. Our New Actros are everything we hoped they would be. We were looking for an improvement in fuel consumption and they've delivered from day one.”
The Actros is well-known for delivering excellent fuel economy and when running a haulage firm, this is a major consideration with thousands of miles being covered each year. What might seem a small saving will end up being quite significant when the benefits are applied to an entire fleet. As well as the rigid, the firm are awaiting two 1845 ClassicSpaces and an 1845 StreamSpace, as well as a 6x2 2551 which features a 510hp engine and a top of the range GigaSpace cab.

item.title: Meachers invests in Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Global logistics firm, Meachers, has recently invested £1.25m in 16 Mercedes Actros trucks. The new vehicles will be phased in over the coming months and should all be in operation by Christmas. They will operate out of two locations – the firm’s headquarters in Southampton and from the East Midlands depot, which is located in Derby. The firm’s managing director, Stuart Terris said:
“We have ambitious plans for the future of our business and our long-term strategy reflects the need to continually evolve to meet the changing needs of the workplace. This requires a continued investment in our equipment, our facilities and our people.”
A heavy-duty truck, the Actros is generally used for haulage. One of the main advantages is that it comes with an electric gearbox. Allied to software which calculates the most appropriate gear at any given moment, engine wear and tear is significantly reduced. It is also a very economical truck to run, setting a world record in 2008 as the most fuel efficient 40 ton truck following a test at the Nardo track in Italy.

item.title: Fleet demonstrates new Mercedes-Benz Actros is even more economical
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
The Mercedes-Benz Actros has long been known as an economical truck, making it ideal for haulage companies or indeed any firm that needs a large, high mileage vehicle capable of carrying heavy loads. Even more impressively, the new version of the Actros has been shown to be even more efficient. Before it was launched, the aim was to ensure that the new Actros provided six per cent savings over the model it was replacing. However, the Irish dealer demonstration fleet has substantially exceeded this. The vehicles involved have covered more than 250,000km and are being driven in real-life conditions by Irish operators. This is not a lab test. It is the genuine experience of those using the vehicle. Mercedes-Benz commercial vehicles sales manager, Fergus Conheady, said:
“This is an excellent result, especially when one remembers that the tests were conducted on similar routes with similar load profiles and the fact that the previous Actros held an official record for fuel economy.”

item.title: Protect your firm from rising fuel costs
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
It is impossible to predict what fuel costs might be in coming years, but that doesn’t mean it isn’t possible to maintain some level of control. The important thing to remember is that you are competing against other firms for the same business and therefore it is a level playing field. If fuel costs go up, they will feel it just as much as you.
Or will they? If you are smart, you will realise that while the price of fuel is out of your hands, the impact of it on your firm can be managed. Should you invest in vehicles which are more fuel efficient, you could actually argue that you stand to gain from rising fuel costs.
This seems counter-intuitive – after all, fuel costs are one of the greatest expenses for any firm that operates a fleet of vehicles. However, it is important to remember that you are only competing against other firms. If costs rise, so do prices and if your fleet is more fuel efficient than others then you actually stand to profit from this situation, because you will be able to offer better rates or take greater profit.

item.title: Factor in repairs and fuel when pricing up vans and trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
When purchasing additional vehicles for a fleet, it is easy to inadvertently make short-term decisions. The initial cost of a van or truck is considerable and this can blind you to the importance of other factors.
To make a good decision for your firm, you need to think long-term. Yes, you may be able to save money by buying one vehicle rather than another, but what are the consequences of this decision? The financial costs do not end with the initial vehicle.
Maintenance costs can be considerable, so a robust, reliable vehicle can save you money in the long run. Breakdowns take a vehicle out of action for a period of time, as well as bringing repair costs. As long as a van or truck is off the road, it is not carrying out work and contributing to your revenue.
Similarly, fuel costs should be a massive consideration. Fuel is something you can be certain will be a major expense for the entire lifespan of the vehicle. If it runs efficiently, these costs are reduced and spread across an entire fleet, these savings can be considerable.

item.title: Fuel efficiency is one of several considerations when adding to your fleet
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
If you’re responsible for the management of a fleet of vehicles, you have to take a number of things into account when purchasing new vehicles. Fuel efficiency will be one of the most significant elements.
You need to ensure that the vehicles you get are suitable for the work they will be carrying out. They need to be big enough and powerful enough that they can carry all that they need to, but in many cases you will also have specific needs with regards to loading and unloading the vehicle.
Then there is the initial outlay. This often gets more attention that it merits. Although the cost of purchasing vehicles is great, it has to be remembered that they will be used for quite some time to come. It is better to have a safe and reliable vehicle that costs slightly more than to make compromises.
Breakdowns lead to additional expense and then there are the running costs. As was mentioned, fuel efficiency is as important as anything. The true cost of any given vehicle incorporates every cost over the course of its entire working life.

item.title: How truck fuel savings can be made
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Any firm involved in the transportation of goods by road will be keen to make fuel savings. As well as being better for the environment, there is a strong business case for doing so as fuel is generally one of the largest outgoings in such industries.
There are many ways in which savings can be made. Some are within a business’s control. For others, they are dependent on vehicle manufacturers.
For the former, satellite tracking and navigation systems ensure optimal route planning, meaning trucks are travelling fewer miles, while driver training should help staff drive more responsibly and efficiently. For the latter, various design innovations help vehicles achieve more miles per gallon.
Manufacturers often target their efforts on the engine, attempting to create one which runs more economically. Weight reductions also have a significant impact as less power is required to propel the vehicle. However, aerodynamics are often overlooked.
This is strange as aerodynamics can have a huge impact on performance. A new Mercedes-Benz truck has been designed to be 18 per cent more aerodynamic than its predecessor. This would save the average operator around 3,000 euros per year in fuel.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz develop more aerodynamic truck and trailer
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
The IAA Commercial Vehicles Show recently saw a new Mercedes-Benz truck and trailer displayed. The latest design is said to reduce air resistance by a whopping 18 per cent compared to the conventional Mercedes-Benz Actros. In everyday conditions, this could lead to fuel savings of between four and five per cent.
The benefits are not only financial, but environmental as well. If annual mileage were 150,000km a saving such as this would amount to 2,000 litres and five tonnes of CO2 each year. This is not insignificant.
The savings have been achieved through the adoption of a number of measures. Most strikingly, there is a spoiler on the bulkhead, reducing the distance to the tractor unit. This is said to lower air resistance by one per cent in itself. There are also plastic side trim panels which provide a one to two per cent reduction. However, the rear taper is most influential, providing a seven per cent improvement.
Mercedes has also applied the same principles to a rigid truck – specifically, the Antos. The result is a 12 per cent improvement in aerodynamics, which could reduce fuel consumption by around three per cent.

item.title: Minimise downtime with regular servicing
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
When buying new vehicles for a fleet, it’s important to weigh up the cost over the entire life cycle of the van or truck. The initial outlay is one thing, but there are fuel costs and servicing on top of that. There may also be costs associated with breakdowns, so it pays to invest in vehicles which have a reputation for being reliable.
This also underlines the importance of regular servicing. A breakdown is not just a cost in itself – it also means a vehicle being off the road at a time when it is needed. By scheduling regular services, you can keep your fleet on the road and functioning properly.
A service will see threats and problems nipped in the bud and, more importantly, it means that you can plan. A breakdown forces you to act, but a service can be worked into your schedule with minimal disruption. It’s sometimes possible to have work carried out overnight, meaning no downtime whatsoever. A service will see detailed inspections and vital maintenance carried out, meaning you have peace of mind and can focus on your business.

item.title: South Yorkshire haulier makes fuel savings after turning to the Actros
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
South Yorkshire haulier, Ken Mallinson and Sons has added 10 new Actros 2545 tractor units to its fleet, two of which are the ultra low emission Euro 6 models. Since their arrival, they have been achieving an extra two miles per gallon compared to the fleet average, resulting in notable fuel savings. Business development manager, Ian Egan, said of the 450hp 2.5m wide trucks:
"Within the first two weeks one of the Euro 5 units came back with an average of 10.65mpg, and the Euro 6s were recording 9.7-9.8mpg. We carry a lot of plastic products so we're not fully freighted all the time - but given our previous overall average of 8.4-8.6mpg these figures obviously made us sit up and take notice."
The new Actros trucks are being used for nationwide haulage work, pulling 4.5m high curtainsiders or flatbed trailers. Egan says the firm favours Mercedes-Benz vehicles, using Axors as well. He cites reliability as a key advantage but emphasises that breakdown cover is also a consideration. The trucks have been popular with the drivers and it is expected that mileage per gallon will improve still further as the trucks bed in.

item.title: Link-It Logistics makes use of Atego sleeper cabs
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Link-It Logistics is an express distribution specialist with its headquarters in Magherafelt, Londonderry and a transit warehouse located near Maastricht in the Netherlands. It covers all EU countries and also Norway and Switzerland on behalf of a US computer networking firm. The firm operates with a fleet of 22 trucks and vans and when it came to adding new vehicles recently, it took the democratic step of asking its drivers which vehicles they preferred. European logistics manager, Colm Diamond, said:
"We operate to tight schedules and our vehicles are never in any one country for more than a couple of days. It's a demanding job for our drivers, all but one of whom are from Northern Ireland, so last year we conducted a survey and invited them to tell us which trucks they preferred. The result was an overwhelming vote in favour of Mercedes-Benz."
As a result, four 7.5-tonne Atego 818s were added. The vehicles feature high-roofed sleeper cabs and four identical trucks had been bought the previous year as well as two Actros MegaSpaces. Diamond says the firm’s vehicles cover high mileages and so he feels it is vital to have the back-up of a trusted manufacturer like Mercedes-Benz.

item.title: Vehicle tracking and fleet management
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
The most common use of GPS technology is for navigation, but there are other less immediately obvious benefits as well. One is that as well as each driver knowing whether they are, the fleet manager does too.
This is of huge benefit when a firm needs to react quickly and the fleet manager needs to find the employee who is nearest a particular location so that the company can respond to a call more swiftly. However, it is also helpful should one of the fleet vehicles suffer a breakdown.
Through servicing and maintenance, the chances of a vehicle breaking down are minimised, but if you operate a large fleet, there is always the chance that it could happen. When drivers are doing high mileage and operating in unfamiliar areas, this could pose a problem. How do you find a vehicle when no-one knows where it is?
Fortunately, with GPS, such issues are easily resolved. The fleet manager will have the data available and will be able to direct whoever is going to assist the broken down vehicle. It may even be that goods on that particular van or truck need to be collected and delivered if it cannot be immediately repaired and that too should be no problem.

item.title: Diesel distribution via the Antos and the Citan
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes currently offer a number of alternative fuel vehicles, but for most fleet managers, diesel vehicles are still the bedrock on which the business is built. Diesel engines deliver the fuel economy that helps ensure a firm remains profitable.
Mercedes-Benz is of course a division of Daimler and Andreas Renschler, a member of the Daimler AG Board of Management responsible for trucks and buses spoke of how the Antos served one end of the market:
"For the foreseeable future, efficient combustion engines are, and will remain, the most important lever when it comes to ensuring the cleanest distribution transportation possible. For the heavy-duty transport, we're now offering the new Mercedes-Benz Antos, which complies with the most stringent emission standard at the moment: Euro VI.”
Renschler then went on to point to the Citan as being the vehicle to serve those with rather different needs. The Citan is the lightest commercial vehicle produced by the firm and is the most economical in its class.
Diesel vehicles still represent sound investments for anyone running a fleet of vehicles due to the significant savings which can be made by running the most economical options.

item.title: Truck rental firm celebrates anniversary with Actros tractor units
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
West Bromwich-based truck hire firm, Fred Smith and Sons has celebrated 75 years of being in business by purchasing two new Mercedes-Benz Actros tractor units. They are 1845 models with 450hp engines and StreamSpace cabs which offer optimal fuel efficiency. Truck Rental Director, Clarke Smith, said:
"The New Actros was the obvious choice. It's a fantastic vehicle and represents the very latest in truck technology, as well as being a real head-turner thanks to its futuristic appearance. We've only had the trucks a couple of days but have already received lots of positive feedback from customers commenting on how great they look."
The new Actros has been named International Truck of the Year 2012 partly thanks to the unparalleled comfort and efficiency it offers.
