Train drivers to adopt better driving techniques Your fleet drivers can reduce the amount of fuel they use by: •Cutting speeding, rapid acceleration and braking along with other aggressive driving techniques •Consolidating journeys wherever possible •Travelling at less congested times •Using GPS technology to avoid traffic and choose the shortest and best routes •Avoiding right turns wherever possible – this is an extreme cost-cutting measure, but you’d be surprised how much fuel is wasted whilst a vehicle waits to turn right Fuel up properly Follow these tips: •Avoid squeezing the trigger of the nozzle so as to fill up faster – this increases the amount of liquid that becomes vapour and gives you less fuel for your money •Fill up when the tank is half empty, as the more fuel there is, the less air is occupying the empty space Maintain vehicles It goes without saying that thoroughly and regularly maintaining your fleet vehicles will increase mileage, improve fuel efficiency and save you money. Upgrade your vehicles Another way to make your fleet cheaper to run is to choose fuel efficient vehicles such as the Mercedes Vito van or the New Mercedes Actros truck, for example.

item.title: Cab and cockpit options with the Mercedes Atego truck
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Of all the impressive features Mercedes trucks have to offer, one of the best has to be how customisable they are. In particular, the Mercedes Atego truck, which has no less than four cab options and three cockpit variants for you to choose from. These options allow users to customise their Atego trucks to meet their exact needs, no matter what the application or the length of the journey. Cab variants The chassis cab of Mercedes Atego trucks can be customised with the following options: •Day cab – designed for everyday use •Extended day cab – designed for everyday use, but with a little more space •Low roof sleeper cab – a streamlined cab designed to make long journeys more comfortable for drivers and passengers •High roof sleeper cab – a higher roof makes this cab far more spacious, and the most comfortable option for long trips Cockpit variants •Short radius cockpit – a standard option offering convenient through-cab access, handy stowage space and a short engine tunnel •Long-distance cockpit – protruding instrument support (incorporating parking brake lever) ensures ample stowage facilities, this optional cockpit also offers real ease of operation •Luxury cockpit - this high-end cockpit offers a huge amount of storage space, a soft and aesthetically appealing finish and an impressive configuration.

item.title: Fork truck supplier invests in BlueEFFICIENCY Mercedes vans
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
The fork trucks and plant equipment supplier IP Fork Trucks has taken delivery of two new Mercedes vans, both of which feature the manufacturer’s innovative and fuel-saving BlueEFFICIENCY technology. The Mercedes Sprinter vans are not the company’s first, as IP Fork trucks has been using Mercedes vans in its fleet for more than ten years. However, the latest two additions to the fleet feature BlueEFFICIENCY systems, which are designed to boost fuel efficiency and reduce exhaust emissions through a number of features. The most impressive features of the BlueEFFICIENCY Sprinter vans include low-rolling resistance tyres, ECO-start ignition system and improved power steering, battery management and fuel pump, all of which have been engineered to offer efficiency and performance benefits. Commenting on the new additions to the IP Fork Trucks fleet, the company’s managing director Mark Isherwood said:
“Since buying our first Sprinter a decade ago we’ve tried several other makes and models, but none has come close to the Mercedes-Benz in terms of reliability. “The Sprinter is also the safest and most comfortable vehicle in its class, which is another important feature, as well as being smart and stylish – the Mercedes-Benz brand portrays a professional image which accurately reflects the high levels of customer service that we provide.”

item.title: Tips for fleet drivers on driving in heavy rain
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
The last few months have been amongst the wettest the UK has ever experienced, and this seemingly relentless heavy rain has made conditions very difficult for fleet drivers.
Fleet managers would be advised to pass on the following tips about safe driving in heavy rain to their drivers:
1.Prepare vehicles properly before setting off. In heavy rain, truck windows can become steamed up in seconds, leaving drivers unable to see the road. Prepare for and prevent this situation by setting heater controls before drivers set off, so that there is no need to adjust later on (which can be distracting)
2.Drive more slowly and leave a greater distance from the vehicle in front. Stopping distances double in wet conditions, so ensure that fleet drivers drive more slowly and leave more space in front of them.
3.Avoid cruise control. Whilst cruise and braking speed controls, fitted on trucks such as the Mercedes Actros, can be very useful, they are best avoided in very wet weather.
4.Plan all manoeuvres in advance. It is very important to avoid sudden movements in wet weather, so drivers should plan all moves and manoeuvres in advance (i.e. changing lanes on a motorway, slowing down for a junction etc.)

item.title: Fruit importer replaces entire fleet with Mercedes Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
One of the largest privately-owned banana import and distribution companies in Britain has stood down every one of its 15-strong fleet of Mercedes Actros trucks, only to replace them with 20 upgraded and customised Actros models. Pratt’s Bananas’, a family-owned company based in Luton, has ordered a new fleet of 20 Mercedes Actros 2546 models from S&B Commercials, with each vehicle boasting an impressive 460hp output. These will replace the previous fleet of Actros 2544 vehicles, which were capable of 440hp outputs. Although the new vehicles have only just been put on the road, the company’s distribution manager David Frost has already noticed a considerable improvement in fuel efficiency. He said:
"We were previously running at 8.7 mpg but the fleet average is now sitting around 9 mpg. Given that the vehicles are fully freighted at 44 tonnes most of the time, that's a figure we're very happy with." "As well as being fuel-efficient our Mercedes-Benz trucks have always proved impressively reliable and durable, and are well liked by our drivers. "The Mercedes-Benz back-up is excellent. S & B Commercials has just delivered another programme of training to our drivers, a number of whom are Polish - the fact that the dealer's driver-trainer has Polish parents and speaks the language fluently is a big help.”

item.title: 70% of motorists unaware of new EU tyre regulations
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
According to a new survey, around two-thirds of motorists are not aware of new EU regulations relating to tyre labelling which came into force on November 1st 2012. The new regulations require tyres to be rated in three main areas – external noise, wet grip and efficiency. This change is designed to make it easier for motorists, including Mercedes trucks fleet managers, to choose tyres. However, a new survey by tyre maker Continental has found that around 70 per cent of motorists are not aware that the rules on tyre labelling have changed. Other survey results found that: •One fifth of respondents found the new labels confusing •One quarter said they found the new labels confusing •Around half (52 per cent) said that the new labels would not affect their decision making when buying new tyres Fleet managers’ response Continental’s brand manager Peter Robb has reported that the response from fleet managers on the new EU regulations has been varied. Similar to the other results, the change has so far made no noticeable difference to buying patterns for fleet vehicles. Mr Robb also advised fleet managers:
“The label is a good indicator but it’s not the be all and end all,” “Sticking to the OE tyre is going to be the best option.”

item.title: Introducing the brand new Mercedes Citan
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
To start off the new year in style, Mercedes has made a brand new van available for its commercial customers. The new Mercedes Citan is a compact and versatile van specially designed for city use, but it can also be customised in a number of ways to meet the needs of each and every user. So, what can you expect from the new Citan van? Like most other Mercedes vans, the Citan bosts impressive driving dynamics, great fuel economy and reassuring safety credentials. Here are the essential specifications you need to know: •Efficient diesel engine available in three power outputs - 75hp, 90hp, 110hp •Petrol engine also available •BlueEFFICIENCY technology comes as standard •Available in three model variants – the Citan Panel Van, the Citan Crewbus and the Citan Mixto. •Available in a range of lengths and weight variants What Mercedes says about the new Citan Steve Bridge, who is the van sales and marketing director for Mercedes-Benz in the UK, marked the launch of the new Citan van with this statement:
“The new Citan is certainly creating a stir within the van industry. Right from the day we released the first sketches the level of interest was and has been relentless. “We have a lot of interest across the entire Citan model range and we’re now in a position as a manufacturer to offer a compact van, capable of carrying up to 735 kg with a small footprint, which is ideal for both retail and business customers.”

item.title: Accessories for the new Mercedes Actros
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded: One of the most attractive aspects of Mercedes vans and trucks is that the fact that they can be customised in a variety of ways to suit the users’ needs. In addition to choosing your ideal model variant, body style, weight capacity, engine output and length, you can also add Mercedes accessories to complete the customisation of your new vehicle. The new Mercedes Actros truck has a fantastic range of accessories available with it, such as the following. Accessories for interiors To make the cab of the new Actros more comfortable and convenient for drivers, there are many accessories available. For example: • Swivel table for the centre console – providing drivers with the ideal solution for eating, drinking and relaxing on breaks from the road • Extra stowage trays and other storage options • Electronics accessories such as USB extension cables and LED reading lights • Living accessories such as cool boxes, coffee makers, microwaves and extra comfort mattresses Exterior accessories There are a huge number of extras you can add to your new Actros truck to enhance its exteriors, such as: • Reversing camera system • Chrome body accessories • Stainless steel wheel accessories Other useful accessories • Vehicle tracking systems • Emergency supplies including jump leads and warning lights.   For further information on the genuine accessories available for your Mercedes-Benz Actros contact our Parts Advisors on 01707 261111

item.title: Northumberland council invests in Mercedes trucks
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
In an attempt to get the best possible value for its taxpayers’ money, Northumberland County Council has chosen to add new fuel-efficient and high performance Mercedes trucks to its fleet.
The council was in need of new multi-functional vehicles capable of carrying out a variety of different tasks, which is why it decided to go for Mercedes Axor trucks and Fuso Canter trucks. Five of the 7.5 tonne Canter 7C15s have been ordered, along with two 26-tonne Mercedes Axor 2629s.
Both of these vehicles are equipped to carry out multiple roles, with the Axors in particular being able to work with demountable grit hoppers and snowplough blades. The Mercedes trucks will joining the council’s 30-strong fleet of gritting vehicles, which will help keep the county’s roads clear this winter.
The Fuso Canter trucks, meanwhile, will be tackling refuse collection in the area. Each robust truck is fitted with a rear tail lift and side-mounted bin lift, as well as having a compact cage tipper body. This makes the Fuso Canter the ideal vehicle for picking up refuse in places where access is limited, which is what the council plans to use the new trucks for.

item.title: British brewer chooses Fuso Canter for local delivery operations
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
One of the biggest brewery companies in Britain, Greene King, has chosen the Fuso Canter truck to carry out its local delivery operations. Greene King, which operates from a company headquarters in Bury St Edmunds but delivers to locations all over the UK, has decided to invest in two brand new 7.5 tonne Fuso Canters. Both are Canter 7C18 models with 180hp engines and Duonic twin-plate automated transmission systems. The vehicles, one of which will operate from a depot in Oxfordshire whilst the other will work out of the company’s headquarters, are also fitted with curtain side bodies ideal for promotion. Accordingly, one of the trucks will be used to promote Morland Old Speckled Hen bitter whilst the other will bear Greene King IPA promotional branding. The company also chose to go with the Canter light trucks because it needed vehicles capable of delivering to pubs and bars which cannot be accessed easily by larger Mercedes trucks. Greene King’s fleet manager Paul Brett explained a little more about the company’s requirements from the new trucks and why the Fuso Canter was the ideal choice, saying:
"It's hard work, which involves a lot of manual handling, so the vehicle's low operating height is another bonus for our staff," "We took comfort, too, from the fact that the Fuso Canter is backed by Mercedes-Benz. We intend to run these vehicles for five years but will be monitoring their mpg performance and other operating costs from the outset."

item.title: 28 Mercedes Sprinter vans put to work by UPS franchisee
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
A franchisee of the international shipping company UPS has decided to add a total of 28 new Mercedes Sprinter vans to its existing fleet of delivery vehicles. Meden Couriers, which operates out of bases in Rotherham and Nottinghamshire, chose 316CDI models in a range of different body lengths including long and extra-long models. However, all of the company’s 28 new Mercedes vans have 2.1 litre, 163bhp turbodiesel engines. The managing director of Meden Couriers, Kevin McDonagh, explained that the Sprinter vans were chosen due to their excellent performance and reliability for the courier company in the past. He said:
"The build quality of Mercedes-Benz vehicles is superb and they stand up to the harsh life of a multi-drop delivery vehicle – lots of stopping and starting, the doors constantly opening and closing – far better than anything else we've seen," "Even the casing on the wiring looms is more robust on the Sprinter, than it is on other manufacturers' products,"
Another specification for the 28 new Sprinter vans by Meden was hands-free phones systems, which the company’s drivers will be able to operate safely using the multi-function steering wheels fitted on each van.   To find out more about the Mercedes-Benz Sprinter or to download a brochure, click here

item.title: Sprinter van helps Mercedes-Benz USA to record sales volumes
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. arm of the Mercedes-Benz company, known as MBUSA, has reported its best sale figures ever for 2012, selling more than 300,000 vehicles in the U.S. in the last twelve months.
The figure of 305,072 Mercedes-Benz vehicles sold in America in 2012 represented a considerable increase of 15.4 per cent compared to 2011, when 264,460 vehicles were sold.
Amongst MBUSA’s best-selling vehicles were the Mercedes Smart model and the Mercedes Sprinter van, both of which achieved their highest sales volumes in 2012. Mercedes Sprinter vans had a great year, selling 20,929 vehicles and increasing sales volumes by 26.3 per cent compared to the same period a year ago. The Smart model line, meanwhile, increased sales volumes by a huge 92.2 per cent to 10,009 vehicles in 2012.
Commenting on the company’s success was Steve Cannon, the CEO and president of MBUSA. Offering reasons for the increase in sales volumes, he explained:
"A strong product offensive backed our retail network's commitment to providing a world-class ownership experience put the wind at our back and enabled us to outperform the market and take the brand to new heights in the U.S.,"
"We're going to ride that momentum into 2013 with new products across the entire model line from entry point to flagship."

item.title: Choosing your ideal Mercedes Antos truck
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Like many other Mercedes trucks, the Antos is very versatile. It is suitable for a range of applications, and can be customised to suit a wide variety of different commercial needs. One of the main decisions to be made when choosing Mercedes Antos trucks is which model variant you would like. The choice is between the Antos Loader and the Antos Volumer, but which is best for your business? The Antos Loader – features and benefits The main benefit of the Antos Loader model variant is that it offers maximum payload, similar to the new Mercedes Actros truck. The vehicle itself has been designed to be lightweight, but thanks to various weight-reducing measures, it can carry a greater payload than ever before. Other benefits of the Antos Loader include: •Choice of engine power outputs – up to 315 kW (428hp) •Choice of four ClassicSpace Cabs •High levels of safety thanks to advanced safety systems The Antos Volumer – features and benefits Specially designed for high-volume haulage, the Mercedes Antos Volumer offers a low frame height and high volume transport, as well as ease of loading, in one compact package. The frame height of the Volumer can be adjusted to your specifications, making it perfect for whatever application you have in mind. Other benefits of the Antos Volumer include: •Fuel-saving powertrain configurations •Choice of engine power outputs – up to 350 kW (476hp) •Choice of chassis configurations •Choice of six application matched cabs

item.title: Mercedes Sprinter vans used to market Avon products
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
Mercedes Sprinter vans are known to be the most versatile of all Sprinter vans, meaning that they end up being used for a vast range of different purposes. Marketing is one of the main uses of the Sprinter van, particularly when users choose the panel van variant of the vehicle which has a large space on each side and at the rear for marketing and promotional messages. One company in Columbus, the capital of the U.S. state of Ohio, has taken advantage of the Sprinter van’s potential as a promotional tool. In Motion Promotion, a marketing company, has decided to utilise the Sprinter as part of a marketing campaign for cosmetics and beauty brand Avon. Avon, normally operating door-to-door through its huge network of operatives, will now do some of its marketing and sales work in public places. In Motion Promotion is covering 20 specially-purchased Mercedes Sprinter vans with Avon-themed vinyl wraps, and it will send the vans out to public venues where they are most likely to be noticed. Explained the idea behind the campaign, which has been named the ‘Avon Magic Bus Tour’, the company’s vice president Mike Sanchez said that Avon is trying to find ways to:
“…get out into the field and really promote the company in a different way; in a more fun, yet professional way,”

item.title: The new Mercedes Citan – offering exceptional safety as well as great performance
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded: The new design of the Mercedes Citan has, like all other Mercedes trucks, vans and consumer cars, four main selling points. The first three are performance, versatility and style, but the last is just as important, and this is safety. The Mercedes Citan van excels when it comes to safety, having a sophisticated and well-tested system in place to protect drivers, passengers and the vehicle itself. The first thing to know about safety in the Mercedes Citan van is that each vehicle comes with an extensive safety system known as the Electric Stability Program ADAPTIVE ESP as standard. This is an advanced dynamic handling control system encompassing many of the van’s main safety features, including: 1. Vehicle Dynamic Control (VDC) – a system helping to control over and understeer in virtually any driving conditions 2. Traction Control System (TCS) – a system designed to enhance driver control on uneven or difficult road surfaces, helping to prevent loss of traction 3. Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) – an automated system which helps to prevent the wheels from locking up during braking, as well as preventing uncontrolled skidding. 4. Acceleration Skid Control (ASR) 5. Drive and braking torque control 6. Direct-response steering system   Find out for yourself how well the Citan performs with a Test Drive at S & B Commercials - Book a test drive  or phone 01707 261111

item.title: Logistics firm delighted with its first three New Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
A logistics firm specialising in the distribution of food ingredients has taken delivery of its first three new Mercedes Actros trucks – and is already delighted with the purchase. The Corby-based company, Maxim Logistics, wanted fuel efficiency as well as performance and reliability from its fleet vehicles, which is why it chose brand New Actros trucks to aid its business. The New Actros is already becoming well-known for its impressive fuel economy, which is helping operators to save money. Maxim Logistics decided to order three New Actros 2545s with 450hp engines and Mercedes PowerShift 3 automated transmissions. The vehicles also have flat-floored and aerodynamic StreamSpace cabs, which can be customised to make driving conditions extremely comfortable for fleet drivers. Commenting on the purchase, the proprietor of the company, Andy Lawrence, said:
“We’d been hearing and reading good things about the mpg returns some operators have been getting from New Actros, and ours are certainly proving every bit as economical to run as we’d hoped,” “They’ve each covered less than 15,000 km but are already returning 8.6 mpg. Given that the average across the fleet is significantly less, this equates to a potential annual saving per unit of over £4,000. And on that basis, if we switched all 25 of our tractors to New Actros we could slash our total diesel bill by over £100,000 a year!”

item.title: Continental offers top tyre tread depth tips
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: The tyre manufacturer Continental Tyres has released a list of its top tips and facts for fleet managers on the subject of tyre tread depth. By following this advice, you can ensure that every vehicle in your fleet safe and legal tyres every time it hits the road. 1. Tyre tread depth can be checked using a simple gauge, which you can find at most motor suppliers and garages 2. If you don’t have a tread depth gauge to hand at any time, place a 20p piece in the groove of the tyre. If you can see the outer edge of the 20p coin, this means that the tread depth is below 3mm and you will need to replace the tyre. 3. You should check the tread depth in three different places, using the main grooves of the tyre as your guide. Do this in all four tyres, as tyres can wear differently. 4. Remember that the legal minimum requirement for tread depth is 1.6mm. 5. If the tyres on your Mercedes vans or trucks go below this, the vehicle could be very dangerous to drive. If caught, the company could face a £2,500 fine per tyre.   For a complimentary tyre check for your Mercedes-Benz Vito or Sprinter click here or phone 01707 261111

item.title: Mercedes Vito van threatens traditional London black cab
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
Since 2008, hundreds of Mercedes Vito vans have been modified and used as taxis in the nation’s capital. However, the latest figures suggest that Vito van taxis have now become so popular that they could replace the traditional London black cab. The taxi market in London is worth a reported £50 million a year, which is why many manufacturers have been trying hard to conquer it with new taxi vehicles to challenge the LTI black cab. The big opportunity for the Mercedes Vito came when the LTI taxi’s owners called in administrators PricewaterhouseCoopers in October 2012. In 2011, around 331 Vito taxis were sold. In the first half of 2012, around 324 new Vito vehicles were produced. Experts estimate that Vito taxis now have a 38% share of London’s new vehicle market, and that around half of all London cabs will eventually be Mercedes Vito vans. Professor Garel Rhys, from Cardiff University’s Centre of Automotive Industry Research, believes that the LTI survived so long as a market leader because it was one of the only vehicles to meet what he calls the “archaic” driving regulations, including an 8.5 m turning circle, in London. He said:
"The Vito has shown that it could compete. It is a serious threat to LTI, the first in the post-war period,"

item.title: 10 green ways to run company vehicles pt.1
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded: Being greener in the way your company runs its vehicles has many benefits. Not only does it help your public image, showing customers that your business cares about the environment, but it can also save the company money and improve overall performance and productivity. Follow these top 10 tips (continued in parts 2 and 3 of this guide) for making your company vehicles greener: 1.Look into using tele/video conferencing to cut unnecessary journeys Holding meetings via tele/video conferencing rather than requiring employees to drive miles for face-to-face meetings can drastically cut overall fuel consumption. 2.Consider investing in more fuel-efficient fleet vehicles Although it involves an initial outlay, replacing fleet vehicles with more fuel-efficient vans and trucks. For example, the Mercedes Vito van and the new Mercedes Actros truck are both considered to be among the most fuel efficient in their respective classes. Making the switch will save the company money in the long run, as well as creating an opportunity for the business to promote its ‘green credentials’ and win over new customers. 3.Regularly service and maintain vehicles Poorly maintained and damaged vehicles will never be as efficient as they should be, so schedule in and manage regular maintenance for your whole fleet.

item.title: 10 green ways to run company vehicles pt.2
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded: In the first part of this guide, we looked at the main benefits of making company vehicles and fleets greener. We also looked at the first few of our top 10 tips for greener fleet management, which included: 1.Use tele/video conferencing to cut unnecessary journeys 2.Invest in fuel-efficient fleet vehicles (i.e. the new Mercedes Actros truck) 3.Regularly service and maintain vehicles Let’s move onto the next few tips (continued in part 3): 4.Record and analyse business travel to find ways to reduce mileage Unnecessary trips and journeys not only waste fuel, but they can also lead to greater tyre wear, depreciation and increased maintenance costs. 5.Record and analyse individual fuel consumption As well as looking at business travel, you should take a close look at the individual driving habits of fleet drivers and employees during work time. It can be tempting to make unnecessary journeys just for some time away from work, but this could be burning up a lot of unnecessary fuel. 6.Train your drivers in safe and sustainable driving techniques Every one of your fleet drivers, as well as employees in company cars, needs to know of best practice with regards to driving safely and sustainably. Implementing driver training can lead to lower fuel costs, less frequent vehicle maintenance, lower insurance costs and a lower risk of road traffic accidents.

item.title: 10 green ways to run company vehicles pt.3
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded: There are many ways to make your company’s vehicles greener, which can save your business money, improve its green credentials and lower its carbon footprint. In parts 1 and 2 of this guide, we covered the following tips for greener fleet management: 1.Use tele/video conferencing to cut unnecessary journeys 2.Invest in fuel-efficient fleet vehicles 3.Regularly service and maintain vehicles 4.Analyse business travel to reduce mileage 5.Analyse individual fuel consumption 6.Train your drivers in safe and sustainable driving Now let’s look at the last few tips: 7.Choose company cars with low CO2 emissions As well as choosing more fuel-efficient fleet vehicles (i.e. replacing each HGV with the new Mercedes Actros truck, which is known for its fuel efficiency), you should also take a closer look at your company cars. Choose vehicles with low CO2 emissions and greater fuel efficiency and the company will be able to reduce its carbon footprint as well as its fuel costs. 8.Cap mileage reimbursement rates to avoid encouraging drivers to make unnecessary journeys When employees in company cars receive mileage reimbursement, this can lead to the temptation to make unnecessary journeys during work time. 9.Use GPS and telematics systems for route planning Using a satellite navigation system in each vehicle will help to prevent drivers wasting fuel getting lost, taking unnecessarily long routes or idling in traffic queues. Even better is an integrated vehicle tracking system, allowing fleet managers to track, monitor and manage vehicles in real time from the company’s head office. 10.Put more effort into route planning Fleet managers need to pay more attention to journey planning, using all information and route planning tools available to them. Being organised and planning ahead for optimal efficiency will reduce CO2 emissions and save fuel, as well as saving the company money.

item.title: Mercedes Sprinter vans complete epic 5 km Arctic challenge
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
The Canadian division of Mercedes-Benz has proudly announced that nine of its Sprinter vans have successfully completed a challenging 5,300 drive through tough Arctic terrains. The Sprinter Artic Drive, as the expedition was called, began in January 2013 in Edmonton, in the Canadian province of Alberta. The convoy of nine Mercedes Sprinter vans and their drivers, automotive journalists tasked with road testing the vehicles, then travelled through northern British Columbia, the Yukon and into Alaska. The journey ended beyond the Arctic Circle in Anchorage, Alaska, with the vans having travelled more than 5,300 kilometres and survived. The aim of the quest was to show the suitability of the Sprinter vans for virtually any environment, weather and terrain conditions. The vans experienced extreme cold, high winds, temperature fluctuations, whiteout conditions and bumpy, rough roads, yet they performed excellently. The sales and marketing director for Mercedes-Benz vans, Pablo de la Peña, said of the challenge:
"The Mercedes-Benz Sprinter commercial van is an exceptionally versatile and hard-working vehicle that can satisfy countless business and industry needs as well as a broad range of transportation requirements. We undertook this ambitious journey with confidence knowing that our van is engineered to handle virtually any extreme situation we could face,"

item.title: New Mercedes Arocs truck officially unveiled in Munich
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
After months of hints and glimpses of the auto manufacturer’s new commercial vehicle, Mercedes-Benz has now officially launched the brand new Mercedes Arocs truck. The Arocs launch took place in the German city of Munich, and the construction site vehicle will be available to buy in Europe from May 2013. Like some of the other Mercedes trucks, the new Arocs vehicle is powered by the BlueTec 6 six-cylinder engine, which is mated to a PowerShift 3 automated transmission. The Arocs will be capable of an output of between 238hp and 625hp, dependent on the engine variant selected (there are four available). Commenting on the launch of the new Arocs construction site truck at its official presentation, the head of Mercedes-Benz Trucks, Stefan Buchner, said:
“Our roots are here in the construction industry,” “Mercedes-Benz has shaped the construction sector more than any other truck manufacturer. We have an above-average market share in nearly all areas of the construction sector. Almost half of the construction site trucks in Germany sport the Mercedes star on their hoods. More than two out of five Mercedes-Benz trucks sold worldwide are construction site vehicles.”

item.title: New Mercedes Citan named ‘Van of the Year 2013’ in Spain
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
The brand new Mercedes Citan van has been named ‘Van of the Year 2013’ by a renowned Spanish transport trade magazine, despite only being launched onto the market a few months ago. The publication, a trade magazine called Spanish Transporte, selected its favourite vehicles of the year using the opinions of an expert panel. A total of 192 fleet specialists from the largest plant transport operators and freight forwarding companies in Spain were asked to vote in a secret ballot for their ‘Van of the Year 2013’. The Mercedes Citan van was in a category with four other vehicles, but the Citan triumphed by a considerable margin. Obviously pleased by the Citan’s success was Head of Mercedes-Benz Vans, Volker Mornhinweg, who said:
“We´re delighted that such an expert panel gave our Citan this high distinction”,
This accolade is the Citan’s first award, but it is only the latest in a series of victories in Spain for Mercedes-Benz in the last three years. The Spanish trade magazine has previously voted the Mercedes Vito van, Mercedes Atego truck and the brand new Mercedes Actros truck the best vehicles in their respective categories.

item.title: Freezing Service Costs for Mercedes-Benz Customers
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Mercedes-Benz Commercial Vehicles is helping to make the lives of its customers easier this year; ensuring they’re protected against the rising cost of vehicle maintenance. The price of diesel is at the highest it’s ever been in the UK, with the average price at 141.9 in January 2012 compared to 113.7 pence per litre in January 2010 and 132.8 in January 2011. Chances are the cost to fill up your vehicle is not the only impact inflation will have on your total running costs. The upkeep of your vehicle is now one less thing to worry about. Throughout 2013, Mercedes-Benz will not be implementing any price increases on service contracts across its range of trucks, vans and Fuso Canter vehicles ensuring all customers will be paying the same as 2012. With a Mercedes-Benz Service Contract, customers are left with peace of mind in the knowledge their vehicle is being maintained to the highest standards, by qualified technicians using Mercedes-Benz GenuineParts – all at an affordable rate. James Ostridge, Service Contracts Manager, Mercedes-Benz UK, said: “Our vehicles run to their ideal performance when they are maintained by our trained, specialist technicians and fitted with Mercedes-Benz GenuineParts – designed in accordance with the vehicle specification. “We are passionate about making our offering affordable for as many customers as possible, and have therefore redesigned our offering to make the packages better value and make the most of the quality and engineering that go into our vehicles.”   For more information on Service Contracts for your Mercedes-Benz Van visit www.sbcommercials.co.uk or phone 01707 261111

item.title: What would you do with the versatile Vario van?
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Most Mercedes vans and trucks are designed with versatility in van, but none are as flexible and adaptable as the Vario.
The Mercedes Vario van is highly unique in its design. It combines the lightweight agility of a van with the strength and loading capacity of a light duty truck, as well as being available in a modular design that can be customised and adapted to suit the needs of the user.
All of this means that you can use the Mercedes Vario for virtually anything you want, whether it’s distribution, delivery, light construction work, emergency services support or passenger transportation.
The Vario has a range of customisable features. For starters, you can have it in a panel van or a chassis cab variant. The Vario panel van offers side walls for effective use of space and also for marketing purposes, whilst the chassis cab is ideal for heavy loading and use on construction sites.
In addition to these two choices, you can also select a range of roof heights for the panel variant, or a range of length variants for the chassis cab. With the chassis cab, there is also the option of adding a crewcab with space for up to 7 occupants.
The options are virtually limitless when it comes to customising the Mercedes Vario van to suit your needs. The only question you need to answer is – what will you use the Vario for?

item.title: Mercedes-Benz wins the battle of the auto ads in Super Bowl 2013
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
As well as the action on the field and the excitement of the half-time show, the Super Bowl is always also known for its big brand advertising. Adverts from auto manufacturers are also common and according to television and video analytics specialist Ace Metrix, the Mercedes-Benz ‘Soul’ advert for its all-new CLA consumer car was the most effective this year.
The advert, which came in at just under 2 seconds, was a chance for Mercedes-Benz to take advantage of the Super Bowl being held in its own arena, the Mercedes-Benz Superdome in New Orleans. The ad depicted the respected actor Willem Defoe in the act of tempting a car fan to sell his soul for a chance to drive the aspirational new Mercedes CLA. The ad also starred the model Kate Upton and the singer/actor Usher in brief cameo roles.
According to the Ace Metrix rating, a system which takes scientific and accurate measurements and comparisons after having 500 consumers watch and score each ad, the Mercedes ad was the most effective of all automotive advertisements at Super Bowl 2013. It was also in the overall top 10 for the most effective adverts in all categories, making it more likely to send viewers down to their local Mercedes dealer.

item.title: Distribution firm expands with the help of new Actros fleet
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
A leading distribution firm based in Northampton has been able to expand its fleet and business operations thanks to the help of 23 brand new Mercedes Actros trucks. Acumen Distribution Ltd will use its 23 new Mercedes 4x2 tractor units primarily to handle its inbound automotive contracts. In the long term, however, the new Mercedes trucks will form part of the company’s continuing investment in technology, equipment and facilities. The company chose the new Actros above all other vehicles and models of its kind and class for three main reasons – fuel efficiency, low operating costs and reliability. The managing director of Acumen Distribution Ltd, Chris Doughty, explained what the new Actros trucks will mean for the future of the company. He said:
“After rigorous testing we chose the Mercedes Benz Actros, primarily on its fuel economy but were also impressed with the innovative interior and driver comfort. “The new trucks underline Acumen’s continuing investment in its fleet as well as its commitment to reducing carbon emissions. The company now operates an extensive range of equipment including specialist car transporters, articulated vehicles and curtain sided rigids and trailers.”

item.title: Suffolk council sticks with Mercedes Econic trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
After more than 12 years of loyal service, the local authority in charge of the West Suffolk towns of Haverhill and Bury St Edmunds has decided to stand down its longest-serving Mercedes-Benz Econic truck. However, the council is to replace the hard-working Econic with 13 new models, all of which are 6x2 Econic 2629LL vehicles with single compartment Faun Zoeller Variopress VP2 compactor bodies and rear-steer axles. The Econic trucks also have Terberg bin lifts, so that they can be put to work on the region’s streets. In addition to these vehicles, Bury St Edmunds and Haverhill council authorities have also decided to purchase an 8x4 Econic 3233LL truck with a 31m³ Heil Big Bite body. This will replace a Mercedes Actros truck which is also being retired after years of loyal service. The authority also has a Mercedes Axor skip-loader within its fleet. Explaining the decision to stick with the Econic after so many years, St Edmundsbury fleet and technical manager Phil Clifford said:
"Our crews appreciate the Econic's brand image and high build quality, as well as its day-to-day functionality. We particularly like the low-entry cab with its air-operated folding door, and all-round air suspension with on-board weighing."

item.title: Sprinter van model variant info – chassis cab and dropside
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded: All Mercedes vans are designed with versatility in mind, which is why they come with so many different options in terms of height, length, engine size and importantly, body type. Many Mercedes van designs are modular, meaning that they can be adjusted and built to meet your exact specifications. The Mercedes Sprinter van is arguably the most versatile of all the brand’s vehicles. One of the body types on offer with the Sprinter van is the chassis cab and dropside configuration. If you have your eye on this body variant of the Sprinter, here is the essential information you need to know. More customisable options Even once you’ve chosen this body variant of the Sprinter, there are still more options to pick from. The Sprinter dropside comes in: •Three different wheelbases •Eight different platform variants •Two different cabs – standard or crew cab (capable of accommodating up to 7 passengers, making it ideal for teamwork) •Optional BlueEFFICIENCY package •Several engine sizes •Payload from 800kg to 2495 kg •Tonnes of optional equipment and configuration options Standard features In addition to all of these optional features, the Sprinter van chassis cab and dropside comes with a few things as standard. It has a state-of-the-art CDI engine, a robust frame with high load-bearing capacity, an economical 4-cylinder CDI diesel engine and a consumption-reducing ECO Gear 6-speed manual transmission.

item.title: Mercedes Sprinter van transformed into Californian mobile library
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
A Mercedes Sprinter van, a model already known for its versatility, has been put to work in an entirely new capacity, providing the citizens of Berkeley in California with a brand new mobile library.
The Sprinter van was purchased with the proceeds from Measure FF, which was approved by the voters of the city in Berkeley in 2008. It has been fitted out and transformed into a mobile library, which will now bring library services to neighbourhoods which currently don’t have access to branch libraries. These may be areas in which the local library is closed for reconstruction or renovation.
The mobile library, which now has a regular schedule of places and times in which it can be found and used by citizens, will serve as a pick-up point for books and other library materials that citizens have requested from their local library. It will also accept returns, as well as having a small stock of adult fiction and children’s books inside.
Warren Middleton, who is the library assistant in charge of the library van, said that the patronage the van receives is often determined by the weather.

item.title: Ayrshire businessman first to test out new Mercedes Citan van
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
A businessman from the county of Ayrshire in south-west Scotland has become one of the first customers in Britain to try out the brand new van model from Mercedes-Benz – the Mercedes Citan van. Alan Rafferty, who is the managing director of ARF Engineering & Construction Services in Stewarton, has taken delivery of two new Mercedes Citan vans. Both come with the manufacturer’s fuel-saving BlueEFFICIENCY package and are 109 CDI versions with 90hp diesel engines. One of the vans is a panel van in an extra-long variant (the Citan is available in three lengths – compact, long and extra-long) and the other is a Citan Dualiner. Mr Rafferty, who has been running ARF since 1996, made the decision to purchase the Citan vans after attending a launch even at a hotel in Kilmarnock. He also bought the vans in order to trade in a larger Mercedes Sprinter van that he had been running for more than five years. Commenting on his new purchase, the businessman said:
"The Sprinter's been very reliable and we'll probably replace it later in the year," "But a lot of our work for local authorities and housing associations entails response maintenance jobs to public buildings, schools and the like - we might only be relaying two or three slabs, or renewing a bit of brick wall, so the smaller, more fuel-efficient Citan makes a lot more sense economically."

item.title: IF design award for Mercedes Actros
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
The New Mercedes Actros truck has been presented with its fourth prestigious design award, with the latest accolade coming from the iF International Forum Design Awards.
The New Actros has previously won the Focus in Gold 2012, along with a Red Dot design award and the German Design Award 2013. The long-haul vehicle has now had the honour of being presented with an iF Design Award in the category of product design.
The judging panel at the 2013 iF Design Awards 2013 was made up of nearly 50 industry experts with collective expertise and experience in the fields of industry, design and education. Across all of the categories, there were more than 3,000 entries contending for the top awards.
Of the thousands of vehicles considered by the judging panel, the new Actros truck was named as an example of ‘exceptional product design’. It was particularly praised for its consistent exterior design, number of model variants and the ergonomics and overall high quality of its interiors.
Commenting on the Actros’ latest achievement, the Head of Design for Mercedes-Benz Trucks and Vans, Kai Sieber, said:
“The fact that our Actros has won such an important design award is a magnificent acknowledgement of our daily work,”

item.title: BlueTecEco technology in Mercedes trucks – how does it work?
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
In addition to offering impressive performance, complete flexibility and stunning interiors and exteriors, Mercedes trucks are also becoming increasingly known for their fuel economy and eco-friendly credentials.
One of the most impressive features of new Mercedes Actros truck, as well as the Atego and Axor vehicles, is the BlueTecEco system each vehicle uses. BlueTecEco is actually a term for a whole package of economical and environmentally friendly products and services, including BlueTec 5 engines.
BlueTec 5 engines have been specially devised by Mercedes-Benz to offer low fuel consumption, low particulate and low pollutant combustion. When exhaust gas leaves a BlueTec5 engine, AdBlue is injected into the flow of exhaust gas in order to cause a reaction. This reaction forms ammonia, which is used as part of another chemical reaction in the vehicle’s catalytic converter, where it enables nitrogen oxides to be turned into harmless substances such as water and nitrogen.
Other crucial components of BlueTecEco packages include:
•Stop/Start systems •Intelligent engine ancillaries •Optimised aerodynamics •Mercedes PowerShift automatic transmission – contributing to low fuel consumption and optimum vehicle handling •BlueTecEco Driver Training – a new scheme aiming to improve the knowledge and technical abilities of drivers so that they can work with the vehicle to reduce fuel consumption every time they hit the roads.

item.title: 50 electric Mercedes vans ordered by Danish postal service
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
The Danish postal service, Post Danmark, has decided that the ideal vehicle to join its fleet is the electric Mercedes Vito van, and has subsequently placed an order for 50 of the vehicles with Mercedes-Benz. Post Danmark first trialled the Mercedes Vito E-Cell van back in 2011, running a small test fleet of just three vehicles on the island of Bornholm. The battery-powered obviously impressed with their load capacity, low running costs and driveability, as the postal service was persuaded that the electric Vito van model was the right choice for its operations. Mercedes-Benz has now received its largest ever fleet order for the Vito E-Cell electric vehicle, as Post Danmark has signed up to take delivery of 50 brand new models. Commenting on the order, Head of Sales and Marketing for Mercedes-Benz Vans Klaus Maier said:
“We are delighted about this major order from Scandinavia. The successful conclusion of the contract with Post Danmark underscores just how ably our Vito E-CELL has demonstrated its worth in this large-scale operation in Denmark over the past months”.
Since the vehicle was first trialled in Denmark along with a handful of other specially selected countries, the Mercedes Vito E-Cell van has expanded and is thriving in around fifteen European markets.

item.title: Aberdeen shopping mall gets first peek of Mercedes Citan van
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
A shopping centre in the Scottish city of Aberdeen has become one of the first venues to showcase the brand new Mercedes Citan van, with lucky shoppers getting an exclusive chance to see the new model up close. Union Square, one of the largest shopping centre developments in Britain, temporarily become a van showroom as three different variants of the all-new Mercedes Citan van were brought in and put on display for a couple of days. As well as getting the chance to take a close look at the new Citan, shoppers were also able to ask questions and find out more about the features of the van. Ross Duthie, van sales manager for Mercedes-Benz Commercial Vehicles Aberdeen, said:
"We had lots of interest from passers-by, many of whom hadn't appreciated that Mercedes-Benz now makes a small van. The lads on duty distributed two boxes of brochures and arranged several test drives, two of which have already led to firm orders."
The new Citan has a fuel-efficient diesel engine, which powers the van along with a choice of outputs ranging from 75hp to 110hp. It can also be ordered as an 114hp petrol unit. The vehicle comes in three lengths and two main variants, the Traveliner and the Dualiner, both of which are packed with clever features.

item.title: Custom-built Mercedes Sprinter becomes The Bistro Bus
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
A Mercedes Sprinter van that was customised and re-fitted to become a food service van named The Bistro Bus was put on display at the 2013 Chicago Auto Show, where it quickly became one of the main attractions. The Bistro Bus was customised by Kitchens on Wheels, which has recently been named an approved upfitter for Sprinter food trucks by Daimler Vans. The CEO of Kitchens on Wheels, Felix Eliorriaga has a long history developing food businesses and franchises with his family, and he decided to try the installation of a kitchen in a Sprinter van after recognising the potential future popularity of food trucks. Speaking of his creation, which was a key part of the display in the Mercedes-Benz exhibit at the 2013 auto show in Chicago, Felix Eliorriaga said:
“We are proud to be an official food truck upfitter for the Sprinter. The Bistro Bus is our premier Sprinter model that can be built either with a full‐service cook line, like the vehicle here at the Show, or as a coffee bar, which we’ve done many times for clients such as the Community Coffee franchise.”

item.title: Mercedes Atego and Actros trucks make appearance at Brazilian Carnival
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
Amidst the bright colours, deafening music and general gaiety of the Brazilian Carnival in São Paulo, eagle-eyed partygoers may have spotted a number of heavy-duty Mercedes-Benz trucks, which were making an appearance alongside a samba school. Mercedes decided to promote its line of heavy-duty vehicles in Brazil by sending five of its best Mercedes Actros, Atego and Axor trucks to act as lead vehicles for floats in the São Paulo Brazilian Carnival. The floats were decorated and manned by members of the “Escola de Samba Sociedade Rosas de Ouro” samba school. Daimler, the parent company and owner of Mercedes-Benz do Brazil, made the decision to showcase some of its best Mercedes trucks at the Carnival in an attempt to demonstrate its commitment to cultural diversity and social integration in the country. The President of Mercedes-Benz do Brasil and CEO for Latin America, Jürgen Ziegler, said:
“The carnival is a big event in Brazil because it brings together people from different backgrounds. Cultural diversity is important for us and is a daily reality for a global player” “With our participation in the Brazilian Carnival parade we are paying homage to our corporate responsibility and the promotion of culture.”

item.title: New hybrid Atego truck joins Norbert Dentressangle fleet
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
Norbert Dentressangle, a major European logistics, freight forwarding and transport firm, has taken delivery of its second temperature-controlled hybrid truck, in the form of a specially designed Mercedes Atego truck with BlueTec technology.
The director of the company’s refrigerated site at Miramas in France, David Charvier, has now received the keys for the new vehicle, which has been designed specifically for the transport of fresh and frozen produce to businesses in the food industry.
As the new 12-tonne Mercedes Atego is a BlueTec Hybrid vehicle, it will enable Norbert Dentressangle improve its ecological footprint. This is because the technology uses in these economical vehicles is designed to reduce CO2 emissions by around 25 per cent. The Atego will also be quieter than other similar vehicles, as it has been designed to meet PIEK standards which stipulate that noise levels for night deliveries must not exceed the equivalent in decibels of a conversation.
Other impressive features of the 1222L Atego truck include:
•An OM 924 4.8-litre, four-cylinder diesel engine capable of producing 218hp •A G85 Telligent six-speed automatic •A 44 kW (60hp) water-cooled electric motor
The diesel and electric engines in the vehicle can function together, as well as separately. This means that if the battery is fully charged, the Atego can be powered by electricity alone.

item.title: Antos Loader vs. Antos Volumer – which is best for your business?
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded: As with many other Mercedes trucks, when you choose a Mercedes Antos you will be presented with a range of different options. You get to customise everything from cab variants to engine outputs, but you must start by choosing between the Antos Loader and the Antos Volumer. Antos Loader The Antos Loader is similar to the new Mercedes Actros truck in that it offers a variant to offer maximum payload should you need to carry more weight. The design of the truck itself is very lightweight and includes many different weight-reducing measures as standard, which will enable you to carry a greater payload. The Antos Loader is available with a range of engine options, a choice of 8 or 12 speed Mercedes PowerShift3 transmissions and a choice of four different ClassicSpace cabs. Antos Volumer The Antos Volumer, meanwhile, is designed to offer more space for goods. It has the space for high-volume haulage, and the design is ideal for easy loading. Like the Antos Loader, the Volumer is available with a choice of engines. It also has a range of chassis configurations available for different applications, as well as 6 different cabs to suit different applications. So, the Antos Loader or Volumer, which will you choose?

item.title: Frozen food distributor invests in new Mercedes Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
One of the largest distributors of frozen food in Britain, Yearsley Logistics, has invested in a total of 30 new Mercedes Actros trucks. The company, which is based in the Greater Manchester town of Heywood, decided to order the 30 new Actros trucks after carrying out whole-life calculations for the Actros and other similar tractor units. Needless to say, the Actros came out on top, and 30 2545 StreamSpace vehicles were added to the Yearsley Logistics fleet. The vehicles will partly be replacing older vehicles, but they will also help the company to extend its fleet. The company’s operations director Mark Haslam explained how Yearsley ran a trial Actros for six months in order to assess its fitness for purpose and fuel efficiency, as well as to help the company choose the right cab variant and engine rating. He said:
"The demonstrator returned some excellent mpg figures, so we have every confidence that our New Actros will build on the firm foundations which their predecessors have already laid," "If our calculations are correct, the new trucks' combination of market-leading fuel-efficiency, outstanding reliability and strong residual values will combine to give us a highly competitive whole-life cost."

item.title: Logistics firm saves fuel by combining the Actros with aerodynamic automation
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
The logistics firm Wincanton has expecting to boost the overall fuel efficiency of vehicles in its fleet by combining the Mercedes Actros truck with an innovative new aerodynamic automation system. The company has ordered 115 vehicles – 90 of them Mercedes Actros trucks – to be fitted with special sensors. These sensors use state-of-the-art technology to automatically adjust the roof of the vehicle they are fitted on depending on the height profile of the trailer or container they are pulling. The aim is to improve the aerodynamics of each vehicle, so that the fleet as a whole will face less wind resistance and thereby use less fuel. The customised vehicles will initially be used by the Wincanton containers division. However, the company believes that the design is versatile enough to be used in virtually any part of the business, and it may well be deployed to other areas in the future. The managing director of the company’s containers division, Ian Wilson, commented on the new system and explained what he hopes it will achieve for Wincanton. He said:
"This brand new automatic sensor system is a considerable breakthrough in our efforts to create the most efficient, cost-effective and, importantly, environmentally-friendly supply chains available."

item.title: The full Sprinter line-up – which van is the one for your fleet?
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded: Like many other Mercedes trucks and vans, the Mercedes Sprinter comes in a wide variety of different models. There are currently four different variations of the brand’s most successful van, and each comes with customisation options to allow you to change everything from the length and the roof height to the engine and the interiors. Sprinter Chassis Cab The Sprinter Chassis Cab is the blank canvas you’ve always dreamed of in a commercial van, as it can be converted and modified for virtually any application you need it for. Its best features include an adaptable platform, strong frame, extensive safety features and huge weight bearing capacity. Sprinter Dropside The Dropside is a modern and super-versatile pick-up which comes in a range of lengths, weight and payload variants, as well as a choice of cabs. It is adept at manoeuvring and cruising, as well as offering easy loading and handling and a comfortable working space. Sprinter Traveliner The Traveliner, also known as the Dualiner, is a very versatile variant of the Mercedes Sprinter van. It can potentially seat up to 17 people comfortably (if the larger of the three available vehicle lengths is chosen) or it can be used as an easy loading, easy handling storage space. Sprinter Panel Van The Sprinter Panel Van is a professional’s dream, offering all the interior space you’d ever need, sliding doors and a choice of lengths and load compartment heights. One of the main benefits of the Panel Van, however, is the blank canvas of advertising or marketing space the vehicle has on the sides and back, perfect for adding your company’s logo and details.

item.title: Electrical firm finally gets its hands on the all-new Mercedes Citan
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
An electrical firm based in Ipswich has finally seen its dream van brought to life, as Mercedes has brought out the all-new Mercedes Citan van. Suffolk Electrical Services (SES) has been one of the first to order the brand new vehicle, which is apparently the smallest of its kind to wear the famous Mercedes three-pointed star. The managing director of SES, Graham Dawe, said:
"We've been asking Mercedes-Benz for this vehicle for a long time. And now it's here, it's even better than we could have hoped."
SES, which is on the cusp of expanding its business with a new office in the Bristol area, made the decision to order two Citan 109 CDI BlueEFFICIENCY vans after spending years with Mercedes Vito vans and wanting something a little smaller. Along with its sister operation, Suffolk Fire Protection (SFP), the company runs a fleet of 40 vans, including around 6 Mercedes Vito vans. Explaining the decision to switch from the Vito to the Citan, Mr Dawe said:
“The Vito is an excellent product, cost-effective to run and built to the exceptionally high standard you'd expect of Mercedes-Benz. In most cases, however, it's just too big for our needs. The Citan offers all of the Mercedes-Benz virtues of comfort, economy, reliability and safety, but is also the perfect size for our operation, so I've no doubt we'll be buying more over the months to come."

item.title: Mercedes releases teaser photos of next generation Sprinter van
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
In news that will be very exciting to fans of the brand’s most popular commercial van, Mercedes-Benz has released a number of teaser photos of its upcoming, next generation Sprinter van.
Rather than waiting for van and truck websites and bloggers to sneak a peek at the upcoming Sprinter model, Mercedes-Benz made the unusual decision to publish the pictures itself. The prototype van in the photos is camouflaged, no doubt to keep some of the features of the new Sprinter under wraps until its release.
What is obvious from the teaser photos is the Sprinter’s impressive new safety features, including many that are already fitted as standard on many of the manufacturer’s best-selling passenger vehicles. These include a rear view camera, lane-keeping assist, blind spot assist and collision prevention assist. The van also has crosswind assist, a feature which drivers of the tall van which undoubtedly appreciate.
The Sprinter itself appears as hardy and functional as ever, and it is expected to come with a diesel Bluetec engine of some sort. Rumours are also spreading that the next-generation Sprinter could have a seven-speed transmission, although this has not been confirmed by Mercedes as of yet.

item.title: Dunlop invests in new fleet of Mercedes trucks
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Dunlop Motorsports, the racing tyre specialist, has decided on Mercedes-Benz as the manufacturer of choice for its brand new fleet of high-profile trucks.
The company has ordered a total of 15 new Mercedes Actros trucks, all of which will replace a similar number of vehicles trucks from another manufacturer which will now be stood down after years of service.
The Mercedes trucks are New Actros 1842 BigSpace tractor units, which will be decked out in the company’s signature yellow paintwork and chequered flag livery.
The vehicles will be used to transport specialist motorcycle and car tyres to iconic racing events and competitions such as 24 Hours of Le Mans, FIA World Endurance, the British Touring Car championships and the Isle of Man TT. The tyres will leave Dunlop Motorsport’s state-of-the art manufacturing plant, which is based in Birmingham, and will be in the care of the Actros trucks as they travel to leading motorsport events all over the country.
The Mercedes Actros trucks are, of course, fitted with Dunlop tyres. SP344 and SP444 tyres, for the steering axle and drive wheels respectively, have been chosen for their fuel efficiency and traction in all weathers.

item.title: Southhampton waste specialist gets its first Mercedes Actros
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
A recycling and waste solutions specialist based in Southampton has taken delivery of its very first Mercedes vehicle, in the form of a 32-tonne Actros 3236K truck. Waltet will put the new Mercedes Actros truck to work at its materials recycling facility in Timsbury, near Romsey. The vehicle will be painted in the company colours, will have an automated gearbox (another first for Waltet) and will be fitted with Hyva hook loading equipment. The eight-wheel vehicle, which will also be adapted so that it can handle roll-on/roll-off eurobins with capacities of up to 50 cubic yards, will be tasked with transported non-hazardous waste to road construction and civil engineering projects. The Waltet Group now has 30 trucks in its fleet, including flat-beds with cranes, skip-loaders and 8x4 tippers. One of the company’s managing directors Mark Howard commented on the new addition to the fleet, saying:
“These are still early days but first impressions are very positive. The Actros is a lovely truck and clearly well built, while the PowerShift 2 transmission is of particular interest. “It’s our first auto ’box and we’re keen to see whether it delivers savings in terms of reduced wear and tear on the driveline, as well as helping to make life at the wheel easier and safer for our drivers.”

item.title: Haulage specialist invests £1m in most expensive ever Mercedes truck
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Plant Speed, the heavy haulage specialist based in Bristol, has reportedly invested more than £1 million to run the mighty Mercedes Actros Titan truck, plus associated equipment, as part of its fleet. This means that this particular Mercedes truck is the most expensive ever sold by Mercedes-Benz in the UK. As you might imagine, the 8x4 Actros 4165S has some pretty impressive specifications. It is powered by a 650hp 16-litre V8 engine, mated to a Mercedes PowerShift transmission and a brand new Turbo Clutch developed by Voith. It also has a flat-floored MegaSpace cab and a total weight capacity of 250 tonnes. The truck itself is only understood to have cost around £220,000, but the German-built Scheuerle modular trailer accompanying the vehicle, which can be coupled with as many as 10 axle lines, cost a huge £800,000. The Mercedes Actros truck, the company’s first Mercedes-Benz as well as its first 250-tonner, will now join the rest of Plant Speed’s fleet of 16 vehicles. Commenting on the expensive new purchase, managing director Paul Lomas said:
"Our Actros Titan flagship looks fantastic and is clearly built to the very high standards for which Mercedes-Benz is renowned. The new transmission means the truck is also very easy to drive. It's highly sensitive, so low speed manoeuvrability is excellent, while the automated 'box is also a lot smoother than a manual."

item.title: Service and maintenance advice for Vito taxi operators
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
If you run a fleet of Mercedes Vito van taxis, or even just one vehicle, it is very important that you stick to a rigorous schedule of servicing and maintenance. There are some tasks you can tackle yourself, such as:
•Replacing air filters every 15,000 miles or so •Checking oil levels once a week •Keeping a close eye on other fluid levels – such as brake fluid, power steering fluid and windscreen washer fluid
However, when it comes to more advanced maintenance and servicing tasks, you should always use a professional Mercedes Vito vans maintenance service. Signing up to a repair and maintenance contract is a good way to ensure that every vehicle in your fleet is kept in great condition, both mechanically and visually. Alternatively, you can book your fleet vehicles in for a service as and when you feel it necessary.
With a regular schedule of repair and maintenance, fleet managers can drastically reduce the amount of downtime their fleet vehicles experience. Well-maintained vehicles also offer the benefit of improved fuel economy and running costs, as well as impressing customers with their reliability, appearance and smooth running.

item.title: Mercedes exhibits vintage trucks at Retro Classics show
item.dc:creator: tony
item.content:encoded:
At the recent Retro Classics 2013 event held in Germany, Mercedes-Benz has exhibited 14 of its classic construction vehicles. The manufacturer also put a number of its more modern heavy-duty Mercedes trucks on display.
Retro Classics 2013, held in Stuttgart between March 7th and 10th, is described by the organisers as being one of the most important events on the international classic car scene. Collectors, fans, dealers and brand representatives from all over the world meet to enjoy the exhibitions and take part in classic car auctions.
At this year’s event, Mercedes-Benz decided to put 14 of its best classic construction vehicles on display, including the 5 tonne, 35hp spur gear hub drive truck made from 1908 to 1911 by Daimler. Also featured in the display were 1960s-era round-bonnet models, as well as ‘new generation’ vehicles from the 1970s and 1980s.
Representing the 1990s were Mercedes Actros trucks, including the Actros 1 and the Actros 3, as well as the first Actros ever made.
The brand also gave fans a sneak peek of its brand new model, the Mercedes Arocs truck, although only a design study was displayed at Retro Classics 2013. The world premiere of the Arocs will take place at the Bauma show in Munich in mid-April.

item.title: Figures show Mercedes vans had a great 2012
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
According to the recently compiled sales figures, the vans division of Mercedes-Benz had a great year in 2012. The sales figures and revenues posted by Mercedes-Benz Vans in 2012 in the U.S. do not quite equal the success of 2011, but they still show that 2012 was a strong year for the division. Around 252,400 units were sold in the U.S. last year, which is only 4 per cent down on the 264,200 vans sold in 2011. As for revenue, a total of $11.8 billion was recorded in 2012. This is almost exactly the same as the revenue reported in 2011. In terms of profits, Mercedes-Benz Vans has experienced a 35 per cent drop compared to 2011, but the result for the whole year was still the division’s third-best annual operating total. Commenting on the division’s continuing success, which can be partly attributed to the release of key van models into very specific target markets, was the head of Mercedes-Benz Vans, Volker Mornhinweg, who said:
“The division also continues to be the world’s most profitable van manufacturer, with a return on sales of 6%,” “We are continuously extending our lead and focusing on achieving profitable growth with first-rate vans.”

item.title: Mercedes Atego achieves Euro VI compliance ahead of the competition
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded:
Although there are many months until the new emissions standards are officially imposed in Europe, Mercedes-Benz has already managed to ensure that its new Atego truck is Euro VI-compliant and fully ready for the market.
The development of Mercedes Atego trucks is part of an ongoing initiative on the part of the company to get Euro VI-compliant trucks out into the market, before the deadline for compliance falls.
The Atego uses the brand’s innovative Blue Efficiency Power technology, along with a new Medium Duty Engine Generation platform, to achieve total compliance with the new regulations. The vehicle also has diesel particulate filters, exhaust gas recirculation and SCR systems. Additionally, Mercedes-Benz has promised users that the new Atego will not need to be serviced as frequently as its competitors.
The Atego is not the only one to be compliant with new European emissions standards. Mercedes-Benz has made sure that it now offers Euro VI-compliant models across its entire range of light, medium and heavy-duty Mercedes trucks. Examples of these compliant models include the Mercedes Actros truck, which was released in 2011, the Mercedes Antos in 2012 and the brand new Mercedes Arocs in 2013.

item.title: A look at the Mercedes Sprinter van…from the inside
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
In everyday life, it is likely that you see hundreds of Mercedes Sprinter vans, even if you don’t realise it at the time. Sprinter vans are very versatile and have been used for everything from mini-buses and other forms of passenger transport to ambulances, mobile libraries and distribution and delivery vehicles.
If you’ve ever admired a Sprinter van from the outside, you might be interested to know that the model, one of the most popular of all Mercedes vans, is just as impressive on the inside. Features include:
•A generous and very comfortable cabin space •Fully adjustable driver’s seat and steering wheel •Gear lever with joystick-like design •Superior sound insulation to ensure peace and quiet inside the van •The latest generation radios •Powerful heating and ventilation systems for all weathers and seasons •Dual passenger seat with a fold down table, cup holders and a handy stowage compartment •Multi-function trip computer (an optional choice) •Controls for technologically advanced systems such as Start-off Assist and Parktronic, the latter of which has a visual display in the exterior mirror as well as an audible signal to help you park more easily and safely.

item.title: Colin Lawson Transport invests in two new Actros trucks
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
A transport firm based in Aberdeen has taken delivery of two brand new Mercedes Actros trucks, after the boss of the company came face-to-face with the model at a launch show last year. Colin Lawson, the owner of Colin Lawson Transport, actually climbed aboard the New Actros in the Mercedes-Benz exhibition area at 2012’2 CV show. He was so impressed that he ordered two brand new Actros 2551 trucks with GigaSpace cabs and 12.8 litres, 510Hp engines for his company. The new Mercedes Actros trucks will be put to work right away, being assigned to a new venture launched by the transport firm. The company, which specialises in transporting drilling equipment along with tools for the gas and oil industries, is planning to launch its first European service. The new trucks will be a big part of the new venture. Commenting on his new purchases, Mr Lawson said:
"We have a broad portfolio of customers and the opportunity to undertake international work has been there for a while. The New Actros could not have come at a better time, as the arrival of these new flagships has spurred us to 'dip our toe' and take on our first Continental assignments."

item.title: Fuso trucks supplied to Malaysian waste management firm
item.dc:creator: kerry
item.content:encoded:
According to news agencies in the country, Mercedes-Benz Malaysia has just agreed an exciting new deal to supply a leading waste management company with a total of 466 new Fuso trucks. The Fuso trucks, which bear the brand name Mitsubishi but whose parent company is Daimler, the corporation which also produces Mercedes trucks, will be supplied to SWM Environment in batches, with the total order being completed by September 2013. The trucks will be green engine Euro 2 vehicles, enabling the company to speed up its turnaround time for cleansing and waste collection services, without damaging its green credentials or boosting its fuel costs. Dr Azir Abdul Malik, the executive director of SWM, which is the concessionaire for environment and waste management services in the country, commented on the deal in a recent press conference. He said:
“As SWM grow and expands its current fleet, we look for commercial vehicles that are technologically advanced and proven for their quality. We invest in products that enable a faster turnaround time for our services rendered. “Fuso has been our truck chassis supplier of choice because its vehicles are reliable, durable and lower in cost of ownership which are suitable for our business”.

item.title: New safety systems in Mercedes Sprinter vans a ‘world first’
item.dc:creator: karen
item.content:encoded: According to Mercedes-Benz, the company’s brand new range of Mercedes Sprinter vans are a ‘world first’ in terms of safety, having five new safety assistance features and being fully Euro 6 compliant. The new Sprinter is unlike previous Mercedes vans, and previous Sprinter vans, thanks to three brand new safety features designed to help prevent accidents and keep drivers on course. The new world premieres for Mercedes include: •Collision Prevention Assist – the system sounds an alert when the vehicle comes too near to other moving vehicles on the road ahead •Crosswind Assist – a system designed to help keep the vehicle on course even when the wind is very strong and roads are exposed to gusting gales •Blind Spot Assist – a system which alerts the driver when other vehicles are moving into an adjoining lane, in the driver’s blind spot area Other new features on the brand new range of Mercedes Sprinter vans are Highbeam Assist, which provides optimum illumination of the road ahead at night or when visibility is very poor, and Lane Keeping Assist, which warns drivers when they start to drift into the wrong lane or begin to change lanes unintentionally.

item.title: Mercedes vans join Rallye Aïcha des Gazelles
item.dc:creator: emily
item.content:encoded:
At the recent Rallye Aïcha des Gazelles, the female-only rally which takes place every year in deserted parts of southern Morocco, the drivers and teams were joined by a big-name brand – Mercedes-Benz.
As well as running a total of four official Mercedes vans teams in the event, which took place in mid-March, Mercedes also sent a very special guest along to start the teams off in the rally. The head of Mercedes vans himself, Volker Mornhinweg, saw to the start of the teams’ rally personally.
The brand was represented in the Rallye Aïcha des Gazelles by no less than four teams, running in two 4 x 4 Mercedes Sprinter vans and two 4 x 4Mercedes Vito vans. Among the participants were Lina Van de Mars, a TV moderator and highly skilled driver, two magazine competition winners and female employees of the luxury car company.
